author: {'steamid': '76561198078105600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8825, 'last_played': 1709197703}
review: Momentan das Beste Überlebens Spiel was auf dem Markt zu finden ist. Im Single Play leider fast nicht Spielbar da man von der Horde einfach überrand wird. Scharfschütze sein im spiel hmmmmm......seid 0.95 nicht mehr möglich da Puppets erst Spawnen wenn du da bist somit Schüsse auf 400-800 m gar nicht mehr möglich!!!!! Sehr Schade!!!! Vielleicht einfach das System so einstellen das der Quadrant in dem man sich befindet auch sofort die Puppets in die Stadt geladen werden und man dann wenigstens etwas mit dem Scharfschützen Gewehr arbeiten kann. zum Thema Horde...ja was soll ich da sagen echt geil aber auch echt schlecht. Horde an sich geile Idee aber nicht wenn die Puppets 5-10m um einen herum Spawnen und man nichts anderes machen kann als sich einen weg frei zu schießen. Das auslösen der Horde habe ich noch nicht wirklich verstanden man kann mich gerne eines besseren belehren, aber wenn ich mit dem bogen ein Puppet mit einen Schuss töte und weit und breit kein anderer Puppet zu sehen ist (offene Fläche 40m im Umkreis) und ich mit dem Abschuss eine Horde auslöse, frage ich mich wo da die Logik ist. Schluss Fazit zum Spiel: Sehr gutes Spiel mit Potenzial. Ich bin fest davon Überzeugt wenn man hier und da noch etwas an den Schrauben dreht und nicht die Single Player vergisst kann und wird es für die nächsten Jahre das Beste Survival Game werden was zu Kaufen ist. Kommentare gerne gesehen

author: {'steamid': '76561197971580990', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3502, 'last_played': 1705358504}
review:
Juego que tengo desde que salió. Cuando salió era una autentica basura... a dia de hoy ha mejorado pero sigue teniendo muchas carencias. Incluso jugando en un servidor PVE con otros 2 amigos, está ultra desbalanceado en lo referente a PVE vs Survivor. Zombies que te meten leñazos super random, loot que al parecer no existe y que decir de la "fama", un sistema de reputación absolutamente ridiculo el cual te pegas una semana para alcanzar la fama suficiente matando zombies para poder llegar a comprar vehiculos y que, por lo realmente ROTOS que están los robots de robocop y los suicidas de mierda, mueras 2 o 3 veces en cuestión de 30 minutos y vuelvas a no tener reputación.

Y ya el tema building, poco que decir... super limitado, complicado, tedioso y sobre todo, es exagerado el tema de "mantener" la base en pie... cada pocas horas tienes que gastar como poco 6 maletines de herramientas para que la base no se destruya...

author: {'steamid': '76561198004517806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1704749234}
review: Only got this to play online with friends and it only took 14hrs to realise it's unplayable online when zombies spawn (clearing a POI is pointless as more just spawn on top of you), pretty much lagging the game to a standstill, died so many times before able to react to the situation. Not willing to test multiple servers until I find one that feels playable.
developer_response: Hi Tommo! We're sorry to see that you did not have an enjoyable experience with the game. We acknowledge that horde spawning does not work as well as it should and you'l be pleased to know that this system will be further tweaked and made more intuitive. In the meantime, we'd like to propose that you find a private server with settings that would better cater to your preferences and try that out until we manage to improve the horde system. We'd also like to emphasize that the game is still in Early access and that there's still a long road ahead of us before we manage to bring the game to a point where it will deliver on its original promise and before we fully release it. That being said, we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance eventually when we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073497939', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5974, 'last_played': 1705361364}
review:
Sooooooo, this is the first I've felt compelled to leave a review, but my thoughts on this game are a bit complicated and conflicting to the point I feel like it might be a benefit to others. So, I'll try to give you the basic pro cons as best I can in the hopes you find it helpful.


TLDR: This game is both super realistic, and highly unique, even compared to many of the other survival/looter/building games out there. That said, it feels like the devs have focused on realism and difficulty more than fun. The result is a game that has some extremely cool and tense moments, but the sparse excitement that comes from this game is often scattered across an extremely tedious, painstaking, and overly laborious timeline full of mechanics that seem to pay no mind to whether or not they're any fun at all. I think there is true greatness in this game, but there is WAY too much attention being paid to the absolute smallest of details, and not enough being given to even the most fundamental basics that a 'good' game would normally have. If you absolutely love a punishing and brutal experience based more off poor design than true difficulty, then this is the one for you... but, otherwise, the juice just isn't quite worth the squeeze on this one in my opinion. 6/10


[h1]NOTABLE AREAS OF GAMEPLAY:[/h1]
[h3]Realism[/h3] - Now, before diving into why this is bad, I'll also mention that it's a very GOOD aspect of the game as well. That said, there are aspects of this game that are added in for the sense of 'realism' but, they're literally nothing but detractors for the overall experience. Having to stop to take a piss, or the tedium of washing clothes is a REALLY cool novelty that feels kind of immersive at first since most games don't bother with it, but once you have an understanding of everything these novelties entail... there's just a massive list of obnoxious nonsense you have to do to sustain yourself. Tracking macro nutrients, vitamin intake, physical conditioning, etc... It's really cool that it's there, but it's a HUGE detractor in terms of actual fun/gameplay. Your truck handles differently if it's loaded up with weight compared to it being empty, you need to wash your clothes regularly to avoid infection, and you have to have to collect ammo, magazines, and supplies for each gun in the game... individually. It's a level of depth and realism that is absolutely astonishing as you first start getting into it, but after getting past how cool it is on an intuitive level (Which... it's not all that intuitive), playing the game and managing the various aspects of gameplay are as boring and tedious as... well... real life in a lot of ways.
[h3]Loot[/h3] - For a looting oriented game, it is nearly impossible to find anything worthwhile. And if you DO find something worthwhile, finding space for it often requires a significant loss of whatever low level loot you may have found already. Beyond that, I've played on some 10x PVE servers as well, and even with loot drops cranked to the absolute MAX, find worthwhile loot can still be a bit of a headache and is limited to the extremely dangerous/difficult bunkers or kill boxes. Walking for hours (which you will do often) is just NOT fun when going out of your way to check out a small village to walk away with essentially nothing of value. That added to the gripes above in the 'realism' category... well... it makes the loot really underwhelming in this game. 
[h3]UI[/h3] - The menu/UI/Interactivity in this game needs SERIOUS work. Often times you'll simply have items disappear when trying to move them into your inventory/hands/bag, That cool gun you had a hard time getting... GONE. That food you were about to eat. NOPE. This bug alone has single-handedly made me stop playing the game some days. Beyond this basic kind of issue still being present, you'll spend as much time organizing and managing your storage and chests just as much if not more than any time you'll spend collecting loot. That wouldn't be the worst thing in the world, but the inventory management is just ... not good. You can double click to pick up, but not to put away, there's no loot all or speed loot options similar to rust, and managing inventory on the fly is maybe the most tedious and boring experience in the game.
[h3]DESIGN[/h3] - Holy wow... Of all the things in this game that I'm split on, the design has got to be at the top of the list. While this is ALSO a pro, I think it edges slightly into the negative category for me overall. Things like having to unequip your primary weapon to close a car door? wtf is that?? Because of how unintuitive the cooking system is, I've actually 'made' all of 1 or 2 meals over 100 hours of gameplay.

Ultimately, I want SO BAD to love this game. It has a skeleton in place that's actually REALLY strong, but in it's current state (even though I know it's early access) there's still too little polish being applied to core components that lead me to believe it will always be 'realistic', but the game might not truly ever be 'fun' (in my *personal* opinion.
developer_response: Hi XDeej! We'd like to thank you for taking the time and writing this extensive and constructive review and would like to express our regret that the game did not entirely live up to your expectations. We'd also like to thank you for seeing and recognizing the underlying potential SCUM possesses. As we're nearing the full release of the game, we'll be tending to a multitude of its systems and elements with the goal of creating a truly special hardcore survival experience. Some of the things you've mentioned regarding the realism aspect has its merits, but some things (like the bug you've mentioned in the UI section) still need work and we acknowledge that they need be to tended to as soon as possible. What we want for you to take away from this is that the team is committed to deliver on the core promise that we've set out for ourselves, which is to create the best possible hardcore survival game out there. It definitely took us more than our community would have wanted, but we're slowly but surely getting there. All that being said, we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561199223614423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 89533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 169, 'playtime_at_review': 78951, 'last_played': 1712142530}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055074483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1705146867}
review:
Game has potential but the developers have made some really bad immersion breaking updates that just don't work and it would take just testing the content themselves to instantly realize why.

1. Zombies just spawn in front of you and if you shoot then another 5 or so appear out of thin air for no reason, they feel extremely lazy and make the world feel empty for the most part. There are no moments of finding a massive horde and having to sneak past it because the hordes just spawn on top of you if you shoot. They literally just thought oh if we make it look like they came out from under the ground it wont feel like they just spawned out of nowhere, when in reality it feels like zombies don't even exist in the world until you do (that's a pretty big achievement when you have a massive world, actually pretty hard to do that so gz!).

2. If you eventually get some gear and you decide to dip your toes in knee high water the game can think you're fully swimming, and since you have heavy gear on you just get dragged along the floor of the ocean and your only option is to abandon your gear if it happens. I'm pretty sure I can stand in knee high water and hold a pistol in real life. The code on this is about as lazy as the zombies since even if your player can just stand up in the water he wont and the game forces you to leave gear behind for no reason. If the player is too heavy he should SINK and walk on the floor of the ocean very slowly, not slide along it like its plastic covered in detergent with half my body clipping through the floor (First time this happened I thought I was bugged which shows how well this was implemented. 

TL:DR - This game is basically a cleaner version of DayZ except the zombies remind you that the game is just a game when they crawl out of a concrete road 4 meters from you, and the sand in the ocean grabs hold of your feet and drags you to the depths like its alive and you're not.
developer_response: Hi there nolov! Thank you for leaving us this extensive review and we'd like to express our regret that the new update made you disappointed with the game. As we've released the latest patch and watched as the reactions started pouring in, we found out that the spawning system for the hordes does not work as intended. You'll be pleased to know that we'll be attending to this issue soon and that we'll further tweak this so that the puppets spawn more organically. As for the character's reaction to water, that is also something that we're aware of and that will surely be tended to as we'll be nearing the full, 1.0 release of the game. That being said, we sincerely hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance eventually once we manage to implement the changes to the above-mentioned situations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198281259556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1707193047}
review:
Let me start by saying, I have 0 knowledge of this game before the 0.95 update. I'm a brand new player. That being said, Scum was advertised to me as "if you like DayZ and also singleplayer, try Scum"

I have to say, I'm very pleased. 
The survival mechanics are great, the character customization is pretty cool, and the crafting is very straight forward. Although the melee combat isn't anything super special, it is LOADS better than DayZ. I also see the developers respond to a lot of these reviews which is awesome to see. Here are a few issues I see with the game:

In the 12 hours Ive played, Ive ran alllll over the map, down the roads through the woods. I've seen only 1 animal, which was a bear.

The spawning system for the puppets/zombies seems a bit silly. I haven't had one spawn right on top of me like some players, but I have watched quite a few appear out of thin air. It's annoying to stealthily clear a town so you can loot in peace, just to have puppets appear out of nowhere and disrupt you. On a few occasions, the spawning puppets have already been aggro'd and come straight to me, even if I'm crouched behind a bale of hay.

All in all, I'm still really enjoying this game. I just hope the devs do something about the puppet spawn!

author: {'steamid': '76561198390420386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2582, 'last_played': 1706036766}
review:
Spawn mechanics are so shit, me and my friend are clearing a bunker and clear 3 hordes in a row
they just keep spawning next to us. a beeper spawned next to me while I was lockpicking and I died.
it's so bad I don't want to play anymore.
this is not the first time this has happened as well. It's one of the few times it has happened.

on top of all the bugs in the game that should not be in an almost 6y old title 
(in only 40h I had my body vanish after I died more than 5 times, items glitching through the ground, falling through the map and so many more things.)
I cannot see myself playing until the devs decide to do something about the current state of the game.
you cannot say your game has been in early access for 5 years straight, at this point it's just an excuse for not being able to fix the game.

I don't think I will be returning to this game before some of the more common of these issues are addressed.
developer_response: Hi Klowbye! We're very sorry to hear that the latest update made you thoroughly disappointed with the game. The issue with the hordes and their spawning has been acknowledged by the team and we'll be tending to it as soon as possible and tweaking it so that it feels more organic. We're also aware of the other underlying issues that are present in the game that significantly undermine the experience of our players. Unfortunately, we haven't been able to fix them sooner as we're a bit stretched, but we're more than committed to ironing them out before the full, 1.0 release of the game and we hope that you'll give SCUM another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994758549', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1705123829}
review:
Yeah, you'll probably see my hours for this go up, but don't take that as any indication. This game has big issues, both technical and mechanical.

At 6 years into development, they should be ashamed. Not to mention any [b]EA title having DLC is just a gross cash grab.[/b] I feel that a lot of these very clear, blistering problems should be, and should have already been, addressed in previous updates before they get any more revenue from new players purchasing this Early Access title.

It seems like the development is either sporadic or possibly stretched too thin, resulting in a lot of unfinished, clunky, or questionable features/mechanics that are left untouched with further updates. Features that leave the player questioning if it'll ever be fully realized. If only the devs would work on the game more uniformly and progressively instead of all over the place! But then again, maybe there is order to the chaos that I cannot recognize.

I think that there's a lot of untapped potential, and the game is already fun, but there's some very basic issues and odd decisions by the developers that make the identity of the game murky at best...

[b]To get into specifics, there are things like:[/b]

-not being able to boil water at all

-only reliable way to get water without a base besides RNG foraging is a pump in town??? Like seriously, this might as well just be an olive eating simulator because I've seriously spent at LEAST a full hour of my play time foraging for them no exaggeration...

-not being able to cook meats at a basic level, like with a stick... only extravagant meals

-not enough survival structures to build without a "flag" down

-a large, but unfortunately static map that has had its expansion canceled...

-random disconnects/crashes on AMD hardware on an official server

-a very unintuitive control scheme (and an unintuitive way to remap it) and just bad menu... If you don't like clicking menus, don't even bother because it gets so tedious.

-first death was to a hacker

-devs almost certainly do not play the game themselves, and if they do, the don't consider new players or non-meta-gaming players (sweaties)

To me and in my opinion, it feels like they're building this game backwards. There are advanced systems in place, but basic features are missing.

I really do enjoy this game and I want more like it. This game does a lot right that makes it one of the best at expressing the Open World Survival Craft genre, especially when emphasizing the "survival" part. But is this is quickly sullied by what I, as a lowly layman-player, perceive as negligence to what could be a more efficient, enjoyable, playable and uniform process.

With all that being said, the game has frequent updates (yeehaw?), a colorful and friendly community of players/backers, and of course a good sense of what I can describe as eccentric, nihilistic humor most typical and expected of CroTeam.

So, if you want to deal with playing another EA title that has some cool features, but that simultaneously feels like its got chunks missing --I would cautiously advise you purchase it on sale like I did, because [b]IT IS NOT WORTH FULL PRICE.[/b] But know that you'll be enabling a lack of content responsibility as a precedent for EA titles...

[i]To put shortly[/i], the dev team is almost certainly unorganized and maybe even a little egotistical. Their development process, while working, is nonsensical. It kinda feels like they have it showing as Early Access to cover it being an overly ambitious game that turned out bad. It's been out for 6 years ffs.

Here's to hoping the game is fleshed out and tightened up.
developer_response:
Hi sanityflaws! Firstly, we'd like to thank you for the extensive review that you've left us and we'd like to express our regret that you were disappointed with the game. There's a lot to unpack here, so let's take it from the top.

The DLC's that are present in the game are completely optional, cosmetic-only and they do not provide any unfair advantage to those that have them. We are lucky to have such a passionate community that wanted additional ways to support the development of the game, and they were used exactly for that purpose. This brings us to the second biggest concern that we want to address, which is the long development time. SCUM is an exceptionally ambitious and complex project. Some would say that, based on the manpower and experience that we have, we bit more than we could chew with this game. But we're making it and day in and day out the game is shaping up and looking better and better. Even we would have wanted to ship it much earlier, but the reality is that its better to wait a little bit and make sure that we don't rush the game out the door before we know that it is in optimal condition.

What we want for you to take away from this is that the game is in a good place and that we are poised to bring out the full 1.0 version of it in the foreseeable future. We know that we still have a lot of work ahead of us, but we're confident that we'll manage to get it out the door for everyone to enjoy it - for fans that recognize its potential such as yourself. That is why we hope you'll give the game another chance once we manage to significantly improve it hope that you'll continue enjoying your time with it.

P.S. We'll make sure to relay the feedback that you've left to our designers who'll make sure to consider it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040660028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 25126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25126, 'last_played': 1704679139}
review:
I want to love this game, I really really do. I know it's still a work in progress, and not completed, however the directions these guys are going is just straight up wrong. They try to introduce new mechanics to improve and shake things up but it just ends up making the game play worse and worse. 
Zombie hordes? FINALLY! Zombies randomly spawning out of the ground within a few feet of you every few minutes? What the actual fuck...? 
Oh you died and are now parachuting in? Here's a game crash and now when you reload you have no parachute and you die again. 
Unable to continue playing while looting a bunker? Log back in later to find out you've been ejected from the bunker and all your belongings are gone. 
Looting a town with a buddy just to hear automatic gunfire all around you? Oh yeah, that's an event the game didn't warn you about, so now your 6 hours of looting was all for nothing because they can't even bother to properly warn you of events that pop up right on top of you. 
They're worried about all the wrong things and not fixing the obvious broken and most frustrating parts of the game. 
I just wanna do some looting, kill some zombies, build my little shitty base, and enjoy myself but the devs seem out of touch from their roots.
developer_response:
Hi there Saken! We're sorry to see that your experience with the game was less than satisfying. As we've released the patch and the feedback started pouring in, we've found that the hordes do not spawn as intended and that they severely diminish the experience of the game. The good news is that we're looking into ways to fix this as soon as possible so that puppets spawn more organically and further away from the player. 

The crash that you've experienced sounds like something random, if you can recall what happened before it, it would be of great help to us so we can reproduce and fix it. 

The bunker situation that you've described is intentionally designed that way in order to counter potential exploiting of that system by players that would try to escape the locking of the bunker by logging out.  

As for the event situation, there's an announcement that appears on the screen for all players on the server that there's an event going on and the dome indicating the area of the event appears. If you found yourself in the spot where the event will take place, you have at least 15 seconds to leave the area. 

We hope that some of these provided adequate clarification. We also acknowledge that there's still a lot of work to be done on the game, but we're confident that we'll manage to deliver on the original promise SCUM set out for itself, which is to be the best possible hardcore survival game out there and with that being said, we really hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance once we'll get there.

review:
SCUM. Le jeu est super rien à dire ! Mais....Leurs dernière maj... Vous avez cassé le jeu ! Le spawn des Z n'est plus réglable, des objets disparaissent sans raison des qu'on les sortent d'un coffre et les hordes sont vraiment mitiger. Spawn sur les toits, sous map, dans des garages....Le animaux pour la chasse....Pareil j'entend un bruit et d'un seul coup plus rien aucune preuve, juste les poules et les lapins...
J'aime beaucoup le jeu mais s'il vous plait, réparez-le !

author: {'steamid': '76561198799424855', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 12026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 2657, 'last_played': 1711358961}
review:
У нас было два сухих пайка , семьдесят пять пар отмычек, 5 пакетиков бинтов или тряпок, косяк, наполовину наполненный табаком и целое море разноцветных пушек, луков и патронов. Не то, чтобы всё это было категорически необходимо в поездке, но если уж начал собирать коллекцию, то к делу надо подходить серьёзно.
Чёртов бункер! После него вас развозит так, что вы похожи на пьяницу из старой ирландской новеллы: полная утрата двигательно-опорных навыков, галлюцинации, потеря равновесия, начинаются бояки и отказывает позвоночник.
Косяк уже отпускал. Вся кровь давно вышла. А рейзоры всё ещё лезли из всех щелей. Они медленно выходят. Первый час вы ждёте. Потом в начале второго часа вы начинаете проклинать того кретина, который рассказал вам про этот бункер.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168747098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13498, 'last_played': 1704729885}
review: Was fairly fun until last update. Puppets(zombies for people who haven't bought the game) are still spawning underground, puppets are still running through walls, and now puppets don't even spawn inside of 95% of buildings. Like why would there not be puppets inside buildings other than military bases and police stations? You can clear an area and they will just respawn in 3-5 minutes. I know you can change that in the settings, but it shouldn't be that way. I have also experienced puppets calling in hordes after being unalived with one hit. Explosive puppets are spawning within 20 yards of you, so if they spawn around the corner, you don't see them and they don't vocalize, it is basically game over after they see you. The codex/tutorial was a good addition for new and old players. You can also turn that and the horde update off, but even with the horde update off puppets won't spawn inside. For people who want a vanilla solo experience, you sure do have to turn a lot of things off and on (some things will turn off achievements). If y'all fix the puppet spawning, and the getting into/onto vehicle fumbling (sometimes it just straight up fails), y'all could full release this game. Also it would be cool to be able to make a fishing net or a lobster pot and catch shrimp, anchovies, and lobsters like osrs. =Þ But for now I can't recommend spending 40 dollars on a game that has obviously been on the back burner for multiple years. Plus every time you log in, your ears get bombarded with the music from the video. Oh, and the day cycle is 6 hours, and the NIGHT CYCLE IS 2 HOURS. So 2 hours of pitch black/very difficult to see/ needing all curtains closed and no other lights on in the room to just see what is happening on the screen.
developer_response: Hi there taz.arnold! We're sorry to see that the game disappointed you. We're aware that the puppet spawning does not work properly and you'll be pleased to know that the team will be fixing that as soon as possible. As you most certainly know, we're still in Early access and some things that are added to the game might not work in the best manner, which is why we are grateful that we have such an outspoken community that clearly voices their grievances with SCUM. Apologies for the inconvenience this has created for you and we hope that you'll give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060310120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 33289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 445, 'playtime_at_review': 18366, 'last_played': 1712245433}
review:
Das realistischste und geilste Survival-Game welches ich je gespielt habe :)

Es gibt extrem viel zu entdecken, dabei sollte man immer seine Gesundheit im Blick haben, bereits eine kleine Infektion kann unbehandelt sehr böse enden. 
Defekte Fahrzeuge die man findet kann man reparieren (wenn der Motor fehlt kann man den Wagen in eine grüne Zone schieben und dort den Motor gegen Bezahlung einbauen lassen), wenn man Kochbücher findet erweitert sich das kulinarische Wissen und man kann mehr kochen, man kann Waffen und auch div Zubehör dafür finden (Schalldämpfer etc), Flugzeuge fliegen, mit dem Boot rumfahren, Angeln, beim Hausbau muss auf Stabilität geachtet werden, man kann einen Obst- und Gemüsegarten anpflanzen usw, die Möglichkeiten sind enorm. 

Die Servereinstellungen kann man als Admin ändern während man sich im Spiel befindet (ESC - Server Settings). Leider ist das etwas unübersichtlich und deshalb eine ziemliche Sucherei. Einstellen lässt sich so gut wie alles, hier ein paar mMn wichtige Einstellungsmöglichkeiten:

Unter der Kategorie "Vehicle" kann man die Spawnrate aller Fahrzeuge erhöhen.
Unter "Features" gibt es die Unterkategorie "Item Spawning", hier die zwei oberen Schieberegler nach rechts schieben um den Loot zu erhöhen (10 ist maximaler Loot, da findet man fast schon zu viel Zeug), die beiden unteren am besten auf 1,0 lassen.

Unter "World" bei "NPC" kann man ganz unten die Kampfroboter die in bestimmten Zonen rumlaufen deaktivieren (Sentry spawning). Weiters kann man dort den explodierenden C4 Zombie deaktivieren (Suicide Puppet). Und man kann hier einstellen, ob Zombies Türen aufschlagen und durch offene Fenster klettern können. 

Ich freue mich schon sehr auf das endgültige Spiel :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198118898772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 57730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6880, 'playtime_at_review': 33586, 'last_played': 1712500614}
review: Das Spiel an sich ist genial. Für das Geld was man ausgibt hat man zu 100% Spielspaß. Ich verfolge das Spiel schon seit release und mit jedem Update wurde es besser und besser. Die Devs nehmen kein Blatt vor dem Mund wenn es um Humor im Spiel geht. Das einzige was mich nur momentan stört ist die Tatsache, dass das Spiel als solo schwer zu meistern ist. Was ich auch nicht gutheißen kann, ist das neueste Horden Update. Aber ich bin mir ziemlich sicher dass die Devs das Spiel wieder gerade rücken werden. Das Spiel bietet nicht nur viele Mechaniken die es in anderen Games nicht gibt, sondern legt auch sehr viel Wert auf Realismus. Ich kann das Spiel nur jedermann da draußen empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198240267280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 36926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27333, 'last_played': 1709310822}
review:
Dear SCUM Game Developers,

As an avid player of your captivating game, I would like to propose a feature that I believe would enhance the overall gameplay experience: a player-to-player trading system.

Currently, the primary method of acquiring items is through looting or purchasing them from designated shops. While these options provide a sense of progression and acquisition, they often lack the flexibility and dynamism that a player-driven trading system could introduce.

Introducing a trading platform where players can list and purchase items would significantly enrich the gameplay dynamics. Imagine the thrill of discovering a rare weapon or valuable loot and then negotiating its sale to another player at a mutually agreeable price. This would not only add a layer of excitement and intrigue to the looting process but also foster a sense of community among players.

Moreover, a trading system would incentivize players to explore the island more thoroughly in search of valuable items. The prospect of acquiring rare or sought-after items through trading would undoubtedly motivate players to venture into uncharted territories and engage in intense combat.

To implement this feature seamlessly, consider creating a designated location within the safe zone, perhaps resembling a trade counter or merchant stall, where players can interact with the trading system. This would provide a centralized hub for transactions and enhance the visual appeal of the safe zone.

I believe that incorporating a player-to-player trading system into SCUM would elevate the game's appeal and introduce a refreshing dimension to the gameplay experience. It would foster a sense of community, encourage exploration, and add an element of negotiation and strategy to the pursuit of valuable items.

Thank you for considering this suggestion. I eagerly await its implementation and look forward to further enriching the SCUM gaming experience.

Sincerely,

A Passionate SCUM Gamer

author: {'steamid': '76561198069395643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2775, 'last_played': 1709696560}
review: I play solo Scum with self imposed perma death. one life, lose that life character is deleted. You'd think after losing 20+ characters I'd be sick of restarting, but man I adore this game, the zombies aka puppets are reasonably nonthreatening 1 on 1, a horde however, now thats when you have to cut bait and run like the damn wind! Find a staircase and funnel them up 1 by 1, but always make sure you have eyes on a way out. I also play on a private server, now that one is ramped up difficulty, the zoms hit super hard and im not allowed to perma death myself (server rules). I give scum 8/10 purely cos it is in Alpha and it does have its share of issues due to that. The day i get to see this title as a full release it will most likely get my 10/10 rating.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970516754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1704675735}
review: Wasted $20, moving on.
developer_response: Hi there BoneyNerd! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game and that you did not find value in it. While we don't know what specifically made you dislike the game, we'd like to reiterate that we're still in Early access and that there's still a lot of work that needs to be done in order to get the game to the point where we want it to be, and that is a state where it is polished, bug-free and feature complete. The team is committed to bringing the game to that point and we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance once we exit Early access and fully release it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098994867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5473, 'last_played': 1704924656}
review:
Game is great but I cannot recommend it until puppet spawns are fixed, they spawn in front of you (bombers too). Also, if your PC doesn't render properly, you're going to fall off the map, your vehicle [b]will disappear[/b] with all of your items inside (happened twice, uninstalled on second one).

Other than that the game is gold for me aside from some minor inconveniences.
developer_response: Hi there Fever! We're sorry to see that the issues you've experienced soured your time with the game, especially since you, overall, like it. We're looking into ways to improve these puppet spawns so that they don't spawn directly in front of the player. As for the rendering issue, we'd like to kindly ask you to send us report with a detailed description of what happened before you fell of the map via https://support.scumgame.com/ so we can try to replicate and fix it. We'd be most grateful for that. We'd like you to know that the team here is hard at work on completing the game and preparing for its eventual exit out of Early access, meaning that we are working on fixing as many bugs as we can and polishing the overall experience of the game, as well as adding additional content features. All that being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052243391', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 24524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22286, 'last_played': 1705733503}

review: Great game, if you're into the survival genre like DayZ, this is the best one out there. developer_response: Hi there ErectileReptile! The idea behind DLC's like the hairstyles is to provide our community and fans with an additional means of supporting the development of the game while at the same time giving something that does not give them an unfair advantage. They are purely cosmetic and do not influence the game in any way. Hope this explains it a bit and we hope that this does not detract you from enjoying the game overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009567095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1537, 'last_played': 1704654419}
review:
I played this game when it came out, removed it and then reinstalled it 2 days ago to check how it was going, well not far to be honest, still buggy, still empty and can't remove that feeling that after more than 5 years, it isn't comming close to 1.0.

-The Z spawn 5 meters next to you, why ? You can kill 5 Z, get into a building and back out and 5 Z have respawned.
-No mods, this make the game boring, when you have DayZ as a "competitor" (4x the player count of scum) with a shit load of mods, you sure to get different experiences (maps/ gear/ even overhauls like the STALKER mod) and i don't even like Dayz that much, but they played they'r cards right.
-DLC before the mod support ? Feels like they know if/when the mod support comes out, people are gonna get all this free stuff out and they wont be able to monetize as much.
-The solo eperience (offline) could be way better, but it doesn't look like a pripority to the devs, just need roaming NPCs, a good set of parameters to customize your experience how you like, removing having to search for a server that may never exist.

Just hopping that when 1.0 comes out with the mods, people will be able to make this game great, like they did for DayZ.

Oh and if you try to choose between dayZ and this, if 1.0 of Scum isn't out(and even if it is, check the content available), get DayZ
developer_response:
Hi [MTK]LonelyFrenchBoi;'(! We're sorry to see that you are disappointed with the game and grateful for the extensive review. You've listed several points that we'd like to address:

-We're aware that the horde spawns can be severely improved and that they currently do work as well as they should and you'll be pleased to know that we're working to fix them as soon as possible.
-Mod support is something that will be discussed after the full release of the game. We're currently focused on delivering the 1.0 version.
-SCUM is a very ambitious project done by a small amount of people by industry standards and the DLC's have helped us support the development of the game for this amount of time. They are cosmetic in nature, completely optional and do not provide an unfair advantage to those that have them.
-You can modify your solo experience in the 'server settings' when accessing the main menu when you start singleplayer. Just change the settings that you wish and then reload your save. This will apply the changes that you made. Roaming NPC's will be our focus in the coming months.

Hope this provides some some clarity and we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance when we fully release SCUM. We still have a lot of work ahead of us, that much is true, but we're confident that the team will deliver on the promise the game set out for itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198802328864', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1046, 'last_played': 1710260463}
review:
died because of radiation... shure... possible... died because my shoes were worn off.... okayyyy seriously?.... died because my stomach explodes becuse i ate too much... seriously?... died because i felt "slightly warm".... was i in the desert for a day- NO...  
so if the climate in the area is too hot i need to wait 7 minutes in the river to cool down,- how fun is that? not at all! wtf... devs this is ridicolous... calm your dying fantasies... but not in this game please... try to make it possible not to die of everything that is wrong in your eyes: at least in single player let us choose what we wanna suffer from ... and what not!
if you run 30 seconds you will need to stand still 2 minutes to recover...you cant (yet) die because you didnt cut your fingernails... that will be possible with the next patch i guess... its simply not fun in current state because there is almost no progress  besides knowledge: if you die (even on easiest mode) you are able to reclaim the things you had in your hands, you ALWAYS loose EVERYTHING... and there is no perks so considering the first hours of the game consist of trying to find clothes or backpacks to be able to carry available loot- so first you need/worry  carrying capacity,- second worry will be hunger and thirst,... then if ya dont pay much attention as well you can die because your shoes were worn off... easily in about +/- an hour real life.. so start again from zero.... and have enough capacity to carry extra shoes...next time a wolf kills me within seconds because he doesnt get killed by an axe in my hand and gun in quickaccess doesnt respond.... i´d call the game "get a hiking backpack- and/or die tryin´"
if the game would be a year old... i´d say no problem.. give the developpers time... its nice idea and a big map.. there is potential... but guys,- the game is EA for 5 years now, those things should have been fixed about 4 years ago.
Inbetween the graphics arent that stunning anymore and there might be much better games alike in near future... with unreal 5 maybe.
the map is big,- so it would be nice to have the possibility to zoom in,- or at least an indicator like a flash in which direction your are currently facing... like this you need to walk about 10 minutes just to know the direction you are walking into...

mouth of the abyss (GER) Vor 13 Stunden 
3 hours later,- a few experiences richer but still not fun: you can eat too much and ya stomach explodes... you run 15 meters and your heart pumps like you ran 20 minutes.... devs how serious are you in those overdosed mechanics... and id like a lot if i didnt find only yoga leggins, sexy denim shorts, highheels and decoration for christmas trees,- crossdressing might be funny for kids, but at this point i will just stop playing cuz its just annoying and there is no progress at all!
its an empty world with very few interaction possibilities,- you can run around for hours without finding a big backpack, so you are about to eat and... drink... thats it ... cuz you cant carry anything...houses are there- often you cant get in,- and even if there is almost nothing to find,- at least nothing usefull: i am runnning for about 2 hours now... with 4 guns ... but i dont find ammonition...
another try later... tried to loot a drop,- once arrived there a countdown says "sealed for 8 minutes"- I dont understand why... isnt a drop supposed to be a reward? ok... i am waiting... after 8 minutes the drawers open for a few seconds,- another time just useless crap in it... before an alarm sound starts. i tell myself i better hurry,- this is gonna close with the end of those sounds... but surprise... with the end of the sound i die,- no idea why...
another time i try to get back my gear.... run to the place where i died, and surprise: gear is disappeared agaaaain... devs this is not what i call a bug,- this is a gamebreaker: this should be taken from steam because with no progress this is no game!
update with 24h played... it should be called "scam" not "scum".... what is that nice huge map for if there is nothing usefull to find? it must have been about 30 to 50 houses i´ve been searching... always the same useless crap: bulps to decorate christmas trees, sexy denim short n highheels, wool gloves ... is that all u got ? if i look into the crafting menue i dont find how to prepare meds... cuz when i found a motorbike... it necessarily was no reward but a curse cuz i got attention of zombies and... a bear... that was following me until gas was out and killed me then cuz cloth torn to pieces didnt cure anyrthing out. entire stuff lost again ...
Developer... if i put ammonition into a magazine wouldnt it be nice if i could see how many bullets are in there...?

a few hours later... i started building a base... until i recognize its a hot area and i start to "feel slightly warm" until i die... wrong place then maybe,- wont it have been nice to let me know that a little earlier?
okay... i get hungry and thirsty.. but unfortunately the buttons for eating and drinking are disabled... no indication of what went wrong now in the healthyness-section... its just another a confusing and not-fun-at-all moment in the long line of confusing and not-fun -at-all moments in this game... if i would not loose a lot of fame-points each time i die it would not be that frustrating maybe... because you need 100 points to claim a building and a lot of points to buy stuff at the traders.. so i guess i will never be able to do this stuff... it simple stumbles from one inconvenience to the next,- no explanation no progress... 

a better name for this game would have been harrassement or frustration...
developer_response: Hi mouth of the abyss (GER)! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. The fact that the things that were lost are a bug and we'll make sure to fix that as soon as possible. We're aware that there's still a lot of work to be done with the game and that we've been developing it for quite some time and we'd like to emphasize that we're definitely nearing the full release of SCUM and that we're committed to bringing the best possible version of the game once we get there. That being said, we really hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013334039', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 50928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18236, 'last_played': 1710938081}
review:
Bugging like hell.
The Patch 0.95 brought us many things, but mostly negative, some towns are so empty that not a single zombie is to be seen, they spawn mostly literally behind you, and are packed withg exploding bombs. and the usual town zombies are under the map, saw them as i once more glitched out , wrecked my car/boat/bike and after about 10 vehiucles in a week that i lost due to bugs and glitches i decided that its enough frustration.
300 Hours and the game gets worse with every update, 

After 5 years its still in development, means it will take much more time until one can say its done. If you are expecting a fluent gameplay and  wabt to count on any game mechanic to work, you are at the wrong place. you neeed patience, nerves of steele and a large amount of discipline to master the art of survival.
This game is the most complex in its Genre, but also the most beautyful. i never have seen a more beautyful sunset in a survival game then in SCUM, the Devs love details, not only in graphics but also in gameplay, if you are wounded you not only need to heal the wound, you aklso have to take care of infections. physical force can have the effect that your wounds break open again and again , and every time it gets worse, so your ingame body needs time to heal, you need to be more careful and you die if you dont clean up your wounds, use clean bandages, desinfect wounds and/or just le t them heal by giving it time. Nutrition has effects on your abilities and eshaustion can cause you to weaken even more, in the result of loosing strenght or having weaker rexlexes.

i for myself give it a 3 star rating, it is not ideal at all, but sill addictive as hell

review: Перспективный проект. Много механик в которых интересно покопаться, но ни одна из них не доведена до ума (ирли аксес такой ирли аксес...) Так что подробно об этом не буду. Сервера на разные вкусы. Довольно обширная, убедительная в своей структуре карта - её интересно исследовать, расположение объектов не вызывает особых вопросов и порой радует красивым видом и пасхалками. Отдельно хочу отметить небо, оно живое, хоть и не самое красивое.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256084243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8000, 'last_played': 1707015778}
review:
This game is everything Dayz wanted to be.
now.....it may look like Im hating on Dayz......because thats exactly what Im doing.

Dayz which was the original mod on Arma 2 was great, the stand-alone not so much, the game is buggy, you can't drive, loot is stupidly hard to find and is so subjective. no medical data to figure out how your ill even though in the game there is 500 illnesses and you've just gotta guess what it is and take random pills.........(now this is the important bit) even on private servers of Dayz its the same, buggy game play, no data, basically a walking simulator 

but this game, this game is so damn good. 
Ok the base servers are like Dayz, items are hard to find and it takes ages to get anywhere because vehicles are rare,
but the private servers
OH...MY...GOD does this game get really really good.
the servers are great because there are so many different kinds to choose from.
servers based around PvP, some based on PvE some a good mix to make a great PvPvE.
I have a server for me and friends (and open because its cool to meet random people) this is just so good because i can change pretty much anything to do with the server from prices, to zombie levels to how much gear spawns. in much more detail than I ever could with my Dayz server.

The UI for your character is a godsend because you can see everything that is wrong with you from you fat levels, your Vitamin levels to even how many teeth are in your dumb ass head.

the vehicles work perfectly and they are always adding more which just get better, the health system is great, the zombie AI is great and still getting better. and that's the important part, this is the only zombie survival game in a long time that actually makes me nervous walking through town at night OR DAY because the zombies in this game especially after the 0.95 update are an absolute nightmare. make one wrong move and you are running for your life.

if your looking for a zombie survival game id definitely suggest this one all day long. yes its still in early access but its not far from full release and its getting so much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028257689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 35050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 24, 'playtime_at_review': 30454, 'last_played': 1711440747}
review:
J'aime de moins en moins le jeu et je regrette la direction prise. Ce jeu devient de plus en plus dur et je ne prends plus de plaisir. Je ne fais pas de PVP.
Points positif
-carte et graphisme immense
-système de craft et d'évolution du personnage
-réalisme du mode de survie
-Pêche (la chasse jamais réussi)

Points négatif
-Boss de plus en plus compliqué voir impossible en solo
-système des hordes
-loot limites initeressants ou trop répétitif parfois. 5 bonnets en une heure ça sert pas spécialement.

Je recommande mais .... je suis de plus en plus déçu des mise à jours et de la direction prise par la team.

author: {'steamid': '76561199411396914', 'num_games_owned': 31, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 15162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14945, 'last_played': 1704897636}
review:
I love this game so much, started playing from 0.65 and now we are at 0.95, only one step behind the full release.
I know that back in the day and even before I joined the train the game was more "fun" and I definitely agree with that, but one thing we might need to consider is the fact that the devs are adding so many stuff with each and every update, that means the content would be less polished than a game like DayZ in which they add less stuff with each update but will keep them working and such.
even though people compare this game to DayZ and say that it's not as good, I completely disagree, just imagine DayZ without mods. 
I think that devs already added enough stuff to keep people busy for a long while, but the true problem here is not lack of fun, it's the fact that many aspects of the game are incomplete, not that they don't work, they just don't work like they are intended to, for example the melee fighting system, you bash a puppet(zombie) with a melee weapon and sometimes they don't even go into the "knocked" animation and immediately respond with another attack that not only hurts so much, that it will interrupt your next attack, which means if you're fighting more than one puppet you're going to be stucked in getting your cheeks clapped.
on the other hand they started a new system for (stabilizing the performance) in which puppets will only spawn in a certain radius of you, that makes the game less immersive and it will make having a long range gun unnecessary, in the other hand forcing players to go hand to hand with puppets with a broken melee system.
I think the devs only need to organize and polish this mountain of details instead of injecting more stuff to it.
sorry for taking your time and hope this review is helpful.

review:
I like this game a lot though and I already have 320 hours but, 0.95 added the fantastic mechanic where you shoot a zombie with a bow in a small town, and immediately get swarmed by 10 puppets who magically appear with 20 ft of you.I hope they fix this so I can play again unfortunately, I can't, I know the team is small and the game is in the testing phase but I'm really looking forward to this fix.

Eu gosto muito deste jogo e já tenho 320 horas, mas a atualização 0,95 adicionou uma mecânica onde você atira em um zumbi com um arco em uma cidade pequena e imediatamente é cercado por 10 deles que aparecem magicamente a 6 metros de você.espero que corrijam isso para que eu volte a jogar infelizmente assim não da, sei que a equipe é pequena e que o jogo esta em fase de testes mas aguardo muito por essa correção.

author: {'steamid': '76561199118521168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 20052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 67, 'playtime_at_review': 19985, 'last_played': 1712292999}
review: I used to have so much fun on this game, and every few months or so, i reinstall it to see whats changed.. each time it seems to have fixed one problem but then is replaced with a new one. It felt like a true survival game a few years ago but it needs some work to get it back to that. I think the biggest annoyance is the running. Stamina is horrible on this game, I run for 10 seconds, then have to lay down for 30 seconds... With the map being so big (IMO) i think that it needs to be re-looked at. Plus when you play with friends, it is nice to actually have game play with them, instead we all have to run for half the time we even get to play to find one another. Vehicles should be more accessible, idk something has to change for this game to have the potential it once did.
developer_response: Hi Succubussy! We're sorry to see that you no longer feel enjoyment when playing the game. However, there are options for you and your team. You can either try consciously logging off at the same place as your teammates or you can opt to rent a private server where you will have admin rights, meaning that you will be able to teleport your friends onto yourself so you can start playing next to another immediately. Hope this somewhat helps. We'd like to reiterate that the game's still in Early access and that there's still a lot of work ahead of us and we hope that you'll consider giving SCUM another try eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216467083', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 15298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14500, 'last_played': 1705273464}
review: As of .95, the game has been developed into the ground. Walking four grid squares with tires only to find a car is missing yet another part isnt fun, its annoying. If i wanted to spend eight hours getting annoyed while working on a car id do it IRL and get paid. Its sad that the best chance for a decent survival game (because there are none that fill that void) is ruined by "realism". If i wanted to work, Id work on something thats paying me
developer_response: Hi TeQTony! We're sorry to see that you did not find enjoyment with the game. Completing a car and collecting all of its components can indeed be a daunting task, especially for a solo player. Having a functioning car on the island provides a great advantage over other players, which is why we wanted to make that process slightly more challenging. There's also the option to go the other route and buy the car altogether after collecting enough money and fame. Regardless, there's still balancing that will be conducted as we're nearing the full release of the game and we hope that you'll give SCUM another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198435136220', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 5767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4761, 'last_played': 1706349177}
review:
Henüz erken erişimde olmasında rağmen oyun şu haliyle bile sizi en az 100 saat başına kilitleyebilir bir yapıda. Loot yapmak gerçekten çok eğlenceli ve bulduğunuz loot'u satıp tüccarlardan ihtiyacınız olan şeyleri satın almanız size güzel bir gelişim ve tatmin hissi veriyor. Arkadaşlarla çok iyi Rp yapılır fakat tek başınıza oynarsanız da farklı bir role bürünebilirsiniz. Hayatta kalmak hiçbir manada kolay değil, zombiler hızlı ve güçlü, sürekli sürü halinde hareket ediyorlar, sizi gördüklerinde de bağırarak diğer zombileri yanlarına çekiyorlar. Çok fazla gelince silahsız baş etmesi imkansız bir hale geliyor. Tek çareniz bir silah ateşlemeniz ya da kaçmanız oluyor ama dayanıklılığınız zayıfsa geçmiş olsun ölüyorsunuz. 
Bence türünün en iyilerinde biri olarak vaat ettiği her şeyi şuana kadar sunmayı becerebilen bir oyun. Tam sürüme çıkınca nasıl bir şeye benzeyecek çok merak ediyorum. Şuan bile aktif oyuncu sayısı gitgide yükselişte. DayZ'yi yakalaması hatta onu geçmesi işten bile değil. 10/10

review: oyun ilk erken erişime açılalı 6 buçuk sene olmuş. Sıfırdan geliştirilse bu sürede bitecek oyun hala çalışmıyor. Chunk spawnları bozuk kafanın üstünde zombi spawn edebiliyor. author: {'steamid': '76561199249411943', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 56282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 695, 'playtime_at_review': 45790, 'last_played': 1712499259}
review:
亲爱的官方希望你能看到我对游戏的意见和建议
第一个是关于建筑方面的：我们需要直角三角形和1/2的地基和棚顶，我们还希望能在支撑梁和柱子之间有所选择，另外我建议可以在支撑墙壁上做出一部分优化，我希望能改进建筑粘连问提，有的时候特别不容易放到相应位置，建筑在升级时不能在建筑体单面完成升级；
第二个是关于装备方面的：装备和弹夹在背包或者箱子里的时候点击装备或者换弹夹的时候会出现莫名其妙的消失的问题；
第三个是关于僵尸方面的：僵尸在随意游走状态时会穿过墙体，僵尸也会刷新到墙体或者天花板或者地面里，僵尸刷新在玩家周围距离太近容易刷新后就被围攻；
第四点是关于天气方面的：有些地区下雨或者下雪不管房屋等级如何都会漏雨，我也做过很多次尝试漏雨是因为存在建筑的相对不完整性造成的，这样不利于建筑的美观，不光玩家建筑有这个BUG其他如山洞、地堡等都有以上缺陷。
最后希望官方能够看到并重视一位玩家对游戏的期待

author: {'steamid': '76561198009248623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6747, 'last_played': 1704519051}
review:
Everything is Jank. Trees grow back through floors you make. Every server has terrible latency issues. Stuff dissapears from your hands to never be seen again. Desync is pretty jarring when riding as a passenger in a vehicle. The game isn't complete shit, but nothing works "well". You have to relog into the server 3-5 times a day just to fix basic little desync bugs like whether or not you just succesfully lockpicked something. 6 Years and it feels like the game could have EA released yesterday.
The devs are trying but the wait will be a long one. Estimated finished product 2028
developer_response: Hi Font! We're sorry to see that the game left you disappointed. We acknowledge that the pace things are moving with optimizations and bugfixes can be faster, but would like to reiterate that we're committed toward delivering the full and optimized release of SCUM in the foreseeable future. It will take a lot of effort, but we're confident we'll deliver on the promise the game originally set out for itself and we hope that you'll give SCUM another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030761499', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 36146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 23, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1712428262}
review:
Review Updated on 2/1/24: (increase .5 stars from Jan-17th) = 4/5 stars

TLDR: This Open-World Survival (OWS) game is very fun once you know what you are doing and can tweak some of the settings for your playstyle. There's been a slew of patches recently that's greatly increased my the enjoyment and I feel it's on track to be close to a 5-star game. 

Top Features: 
 - Fantastic graphics (absolutely stunning vistas on a 4k GPU)
 - Exquisitely detailed (every in-game object has a purpose or use)
 - Great sound effects (positional audio and environmental sounds are well done)
 - All the main OWS activities: weapon/tool crafting, base building, hunting, fishing, farming, drivable vehicles (including airplanes), squad-based combat, and a ton of random loot to find.
 - Driving mechanics and physics are nearly perfect (you can slide, drift, offroad, and use your vehicle as a weapon)


Individual Ratings: 

 - Graphics (4/5) - varied terrain map (essentially warm and cold biomes); gorgeously rendered (you get better vistas than Ridley Scott's "Rebel Moon"); very realistic weather and daylight effects; great item display as well (with nearly everything showing on your character). 

- Sound (3/5) - sound effects are good; could be better in places. I'd like to see more atmospheric sounds; more environmental sounds; and varied weapon/firing effects (all the guns sound essentially the same). 

- Gameplay (4/5) - You can tweak just about EVERYTHING to your liking; so if you are finding the default game too difficult, go into the Server Setting and adjust to your liking. This can GREATLY improve the game if you're less into the hardcore survival and more into exploration. I found that increasing the fame and skill progression rates, reducing the puppet damage slightly, and increasing the day length turned the game from 1/5 to nearly 4/5 stars for me.

- Travel (3/5) - The island is HUGE with no fast travel (admins can teleport), but that's to be expected. Bicycle is FUN! Great way to see the map while avoiding most aggro. Dirt bikes and vehicles are the way to go for trips into dangerous areas to scavenge.

- Lockpicking (2/5) - works like Skyrim (insert pick and then turn with a screwdriver until the time runs out); however, it's too easy to break a pick and/or screwdriver. Improvised picks should be stackable. 

* Fishing (2/5) - I really wanted this to work. I loving fishing in my other open-world survival games; but this requires too many components (including some rare components) that are lost when your line breaks. Too easy to break the line. Too hard to reel in fish. This should be simpler. 

Cooking (3/5) - Cooking is good; but finding things to cook is hard. Animals are nearly non-existant; I've played for hudnreds of hours and have seen less than a dozen animals in the wild. Cook books are rare and necessary to cook anything beyond grilled meat/veggies and coffee/tea.

The bad: 

Item Loss (CRITICAL): lots of item loss bugs. Sometimes items will just randomly disappear from your inventory if the server is restarted; or are lost by putting them in your hand, taking them into your hand from a container, or simply moving them from one container to another. Putting non-base items on the ground for any signification period will also cause them to despawn. Good for an improvised "trash can", but terrible for actually trying to hold onto stuff you find and deal with once you have some storage.

Combat bugs - puppets will jump around you (disappearing and reappearing) as you hit them; causing your previously accurate strike to miss. This is both unrealistic, looks terribly, and is extremely frustrating. The hitbox is also funky in both 1st and 3rd player. Seems to be a "optimal range" for striking the enemy depending on the hit location; but understanding where those are are difficult to figure out ingame. 

Falling through geometry - puppets will frequently fall through the terrain, such as rocks, floors, trees, etc and sometimes disappear through the ground. There is some mechanic to pop them back up to the terrain layer, which causing them to bob like a cork, disappearing into and out of the object.

NPC Pathing Issues - the "find path to player" algorithm needs to be tweaked; puppets get stuck on corners or in open doorways quite easily. The server also doesn't seem to respect the settings for "puppets can open doors" and "puppets can vault windows".

Original Review: 

Too difficult to start. Not enough inventory space; not enough survival items. I can play for 2 hours and die of starvation because there's no food to be found. Needs a lot of balancing.
developer_response: Hi magicat777! We're sorry to see that you did not find enjoyment with the game. However, judging by the review you've left us, we can't shake the feeling that you just need a little guidance to get you through the first couple of minutes of the game. If you are in need of inventory, the easiest thing you can craft is the improvised courier bag which will give you more space and will serve you well until you manage to loot and find better clothes with more inventory and a backpack, as well as food. We recognize that the game still needs work and we make sure to do it as we'll be nearing the full release of it and we hope that you'll give SCUM another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322550604', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 39992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20516, 'last_played': 1710530744}
review: SCUM delivers an immersive survival experience that authentically mirrors real-life complexities, making gameplay feel genuinely tangible. The game's meticulous attention to detail, from monitoring body metabolism to engaging in intricate crafting systems, creates a sense of realism rarely seen in the genre. Interactions with the environment and characters further enhance this immersion, allowing players to deeply engage with the challenging yet rewarding mechanics that define SCUM's captivating world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090800149', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2538, 'last_played': 1704492650}
review:
Vamos lá... Pra começar o sistema de metabolismo do jogo é muito legal. Ficar com hemorragia em diferentes partes do corpo, sentir dor, etc... muito show e diferente.
Porém o jogo peca em vários outros aspectos essenciais em jogos do gênero.
Dificuldade exagerada no inicio, o jogo é de sobrevivência ou seja, a base pra um jogo desse é LOOTEAR, CONSTRUIR UMA BASE, ACUMULAR RECURSOS, PVP.
nesse jogo não da pra acumular recursos porque ele simplesmente não existe entra em uma casa e encontra uma faca de cozinha com sorte. Armas? esquece.
Locomoção pelo mapa? um nojo porque simplesmente NÃO EXISTE CARROS NO MALDITO MAPA.
farmar ??? não da pois além dos recursos serem inexistentes VC NÃO CONSEGUE CARREGAR UMA MALDITA BANDAGEN ''QUANDO ENCONTRA É CLARO'' porque a porcaria do boneco nao consegue carregar nada no inventario, um lixo de jogo que impõe dificuldades nojentas e impossibilita de jogar.
se quiser passar raiva compre esta porcaria, sou jogador de Dayz MOD do arma 2 então sei como é jogar um jogo de sobrevivencia, ja joguei muito Rust, ARK, DayZ, até infestation mas esse jogo é IMPOSSIVÉL de jogar.
Nota 3 apenas pelo sistema de metabolismo que é show de bola

review: if you enjoy crafting large sticks into small sticks and then crafting small sticks into smaller sticks, this is the game for you. or if you like watching grass grow or paint dry.
developer_response: Hi Benny! We're sorry to see that you did not find enjoyment with the game. The game's still in Early access and we're yet to implement all the content that we have planned for the game as we're nearing its full release. We understand that the game may have a slower pace just as you parachute down to the island, but as soon as you craft some of the initial items and start looting POI's, bunkers and bigger towns, not knowing whether puppets or other players are around the corner, the game experience picks up the pace and it becomes much more engaging. That is why we hope that you'll give SCUM at least one more try eventually once we fully release it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063509965', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 14530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14530, 'last_played': 1704423906}
review: This is a good game don't get me wrong, but it's too buggy in current state for me to recommend. Items vanish into thin air, you fall through the map, the zombie detection is shit, and the sad part is that it wasn't like this before. I think they had a good game and through the updates managed to ruin that. If you have a time machine and can play the game a little over a year ago yeah enjoy it while it lasts.
developer_response:
Hi invader Josh! 

Thank you for your valuable feedback and support! 
We are aware of the issues you mentioned (especially the horde spawns) and the team is working on fixing them. 
It's not always easy to reproduce some of the bugs in our conditions, even with simulating fake lag and what not. 

Having said that, the 0.95 was the last major update for the game before 1.0 releases.
That means that we'll be entering the polishing phase fairly soon where we'll revisit all the features/mechanics and fine-tune them until they are up to our high standards. 
But the support for SCUM will last long after we release 1.0. 
We hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Thank you again for your feedback, we appreciate it! 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198125844518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8341, 'last_played': 1707446693}
review: Игра долгострой в котором досихпор звуки проходят сквозь текстуры в  бункерах. Даже топовая броня никакой роли не играет - только косметическое украшение - что ты в кепке, что в "бронебойном" алтыне - без разницы. Последнее обновление - калл неимоверный. The Horde - это орда, которая появляется рядом с тобой в 10 метрах 7-8 мобов вместе с подрывником и нападет каждые 2 минуты во всех бункерах и точках лута, появляются либо из под земли, либо из воздуха прямо перед тобой. С таким уродским гемплеем, разрабы пусть сами играют в это говно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071630768', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1704458079}
review:
The worst survival game i've ever played. Awful animations, poor graphics make it look like PUBG in 2017, It looks good only on cinematic trailers.
The gameplay is the same. There is no activity whatsover because I haven't met a single player in 4 hours of playing on servers of 60+ players. An unnecessarily large and empty map makes you wander aimlessly without finding anything except of rags and seeds. 
SCUM is assumed to be the succesor of the DayZ and Rust, but there is no meaning in this game. In case of DayZ you trying to survive and move north to find better equipment, in case of Rust you trying to build a secure base and raid everyone else, In case of SCUM you just falling down like a piece of shit out of the ass at a random point of the map and wandering around finding nothing and waiting to be flushed away just like piece of shit should be.
I'm serious this game is not worth any attention at this stage (even so it's been 5 years of Early Access). Anyone reading this should save their time and money and go try DayZ or Rust, there are much more fun than here.
Got it on sales but even so, 11$ is laughable for this puke. It should cost 3 times lesser otherwise it is SCAM not SCUM.
developer_response: Hi there UmbilicalPellet! We're sorry to see that you were thoroughly disappointed with the game as it currently is. While the game has its shortcomings that the team is working hard to fix, your experience with the game seems to be unrepresentative of everything the game has to offer - from building a base, acquiring loot from bunkers, getting a car, flying a plane, braving the abandoned bunkers, shootouts with other players, taking care of your health and metabolism, and others. Not encountering other players can be a blessing in disguise as finding someone without adequate means of protection would result in your quick demise. Loot on a very populated server can be harder to come by as it takes a bit of time for it to respawn after it has been looted by other players, and you have to go to POI's, bigger towns and bunkers to find the best items in the game. SCUM, as a game, is not designed to shower you with items (especially weapons). You need to fight and earn for them. However, we recognize that we still need to add a lot of content and to fix a lot of bugs, but there's a lot a survival fan can enjoy in SCUM. Regardless, we respect your opinion and hope that you'll consider giving the game at least another try when we fully release it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010005244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 21270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13418, 'last_played': 1705639833}
review:
biplanes that aren't the water landing variant are magically made out of explodium if they come into contact with even the slightest beach puddle  even if they are just 2 inches with one wheel into it. of all the weird issues with the game like needing 20 soap bars to clean your outfit or not being able to build ramps on foundation or even just the nonstaircase evelation consrtuctions so you could say, build a 2nd floor garage this one is the most insulting 




the latest hotfix came with a survey

"Unfortunately the answers you have given do not match the profile we require, and therefore we do not need to ask you any more questions.

You may now close this window." is what it says when ANY PLAYER clicks it.. even the survey to determine what was the most screwed up in the 0.95 patch is screwed up... I don't even.... don'T bother buying. I'm losing my last shred of hope here. did I mention that dying makes your corpse vanish on respawn removing everything you carried except the quick slot items that fall on the ground now instead of the lootable corpse staying there? 

And every single patch is worded in inane marketing speak that twists every attempt to fix  a mistake to adjust what went wrong into a positive development, not a single remark about absolutely destroying spawn and ai mechanics in the first place with the update. or even better the one from a few days after the 0.95 patch the "oh you just don't get how the mechanics work so let us explain the explanation again that you get when hovering over the spawn options" that literally has "I'm sorry you think I'm wrong" vibes.  this game isn't for toddlers. at least pretend you respect the customer enough to treat them as sentient and lucid adults...
developer_response:
Hi Fylas! 

Thank you for reaching out, we appreciate the feedback! 
Please keep in mind that we are still in early access so there's still a lot of work to do before we release 1.0. 
We also have a small team and we have to manage resources (people) carefully. 
Having said that, the is aware of the plane issues. The 0.95 was the last major update before 1.0, that means we'll be entering our polishing phase fairly soon where we'll revisit all the mechanics/features and balance them out so they complement each other. 
That includes planes, vehicles, base building and basically every feature that you can think of so please be patient with us. 

We sincerely hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!
