author: {'steamid': '76561198869942680', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 38573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37867, 'last_played': 1710695826}
review:
Coming from 600+ hours of gameplay

This to me is an all around great game. This is exactly what I look for when coming home after work, sit down, relax and just play and I have the ability to chose whether or not I look for trouble or not. Without having to worry about sweating profusely in games like CoD.  This is also a really good game to play with friends, as it's something that can require a good amount of teamwork. Or just something to relax and build houses with friends. See each others creativity. The activities are also very enjoyable, while still rough around the edges, I.E fishing it's still a lot of fun! Although, I do wish the hunting was a little more on the realism side. Like tree stands, or maybe an improvised blind? The sound design is something worth noting as well, to me the gunshots carry a good long ways inside the map. Haven't really tested how far one can hear them in the distance. 
But, now we move on to the difficult factor. If you want difficulty. Well here it is, especially in the new abandoned bunkers. One wrong move and your getting shit mauled by Razor. And if you don't medical on you well just commit suicide, cause you're fucked at that point. Probably just saying that because I suck at the game. Like I mentioned before, if you want difficulty, it's here and in a lot of ways, exhilarating.
One thing I do want to mention is the developer communication with the player base, I really feel it's some of the best communication out there, but I still think it doesn't get noted enough. 
Yes this is an early access game, and I've had it since .3 and to watch it grow to what it is now is remarkable to say the least.
Try it out you might like it!!!

Hi Raid! 

We're sorry for your issues with the game. 
If you suspect any bugs, please visit https://support.scumgame.com/ and open a new ticket. Someone from the team will get back to you as soon as possible. 

Bugs are reported and fixed on a daily basis so we're making great progress toward 1.0. 

We are still in early access and there's a lot of work to be done, but we'll be entering the polishing phase fairly soon where we'll rebalance and fine-tune all the mechanics/features in a way that they compliment each other even more. 

We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

developer_response:
Hi Dev! 

We're sorry you're not satisfied with the game. 
I would say that the amount of content in the game with the amount of content that every big update brings is not typical early access. 
0.95 was the last major update before the inevitable 1.0 release. We'll be entering the polishing phase fairly soon, revisiting all the features/mechanics and fine-tune them as best we can so that they compliment each other. 
Unfortunately, sometimes unexpected situations and problems come up during game development. We are a small team, working on a ambitious project so we have to manage resources (people) carefully. 
We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027511778', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1704429042}
review: Played only about an hour, it just isnt for me, DayZ feels better other than the building aspect. I literally searched for an hour straight and never found a weapon in Scum which you need to be able to cut bandages.
developer_response:
Hi Pender! 

We're sorry your not satisfied with the game but I'll give you some quick tips: 
1. You can cut bandages with a stone knife that you craft from two pcs of stone
2. You can craft a variety of weapons using resources found basically everywhere on the Island 
3. My suggestion would be to craft a small stone axe, it has very fast attack speed and it's great for chopping wood. 
4. I recommend you check out the tutorial if you're new to the game, it can get quite overwhelming for new players and it provides direction. 

With those basic weapons, you can try looting a POI (point of interest, like a village) and you'll find something good! 

We hope you give the another chance and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198446742118', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 66075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4593, 'playtime_at_review': 26238, 'last_played': 1712498980}
review: 430多个小时，终于可以骄傲的说，这款游戏我入门了，地图差不多全记住了，金锁给我时间也能捅开，还找到了一群志同道合的朋友，今天无意间翻出测评，发现很多玩家对这游戏疯狂的宣泄着不满，其实在我看来，没必要，这款游戏有BUG，有不合理，这是谁都无法反驳的，但是，它的大部分机制和可玩性还是很不错的，要求的太完美，反而会让我们滋生负面情绪，如果你忍受不了挂，那你就别玩官服，找个零容忍的私服也可以玩，如果你对游戏的机制不熟悉，那我推荐你不要当独狼，找一群好的队友能飞快的加速你对游戏的理解和认知，特别是0.95版本添加的部落系统，很多人认为太残酷，视做官方劝退，其实不然，在我看来，这反而增加了趣味性，多样性，可玩性。熟悉机制后，其实跟之前差别并不大，至于说官方吃相难看，这个我不做评测，毕竟我不是拖，只是一个喜欢这款游戏的普通人，我玩过很多游戏，很少有一款400多个小时了还让我热情不减的游戏，至于为什么，我也想不通，可能它刚好在我的期待值之上，也可能是我要求太低，但是，它确实带给了我很多刺激和快乐。最后，对新入坑的朋友和独狼朋友说一句，找个队，找个队，一定要找个小队。

author: {'steamid': '76561197987202309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1707254878}
review:
After leaving a "not recommended" review, I still ended up playing Scum more. I had been unhappy about several glaring flaws in a game that has been in early access for 5 years but mostly hated not being able to simply start your own server to play with friends. You have to go to some website to pay for renting a server to do that. I want a good and challenging PVE co-op experience with my family, not one of those games where you come back to find that other players raided your base and took your stuff, or one where other players far more established with armor and weapons kill you on sight, making you start over with nothing every time. I also really didn't like that this game, still early access, already has several DLC packs with basic things like hairstyles and emotes that should have just been added in for us players who already paid to be play testers for the devs...

All that aside, I did as a developer who responded recommended. I found an unofficial PVE focused server with less painful death penalties, got more used to how the game works, bought it for my daughter to play it with me, and some hours later I decided it was time to come change this review. After the learning curve, it can be pretty fun and often beautiful to look at. I switched my review to recommended, but not for long...

After dumping probably 20+ hours into playing together on the server we liked, we came back to find that it was gone. Guess the owner stopped paying for it or something. Neither of us want to start all over on another server, especially knowing this will likely just happen again. 

My daughter and I both got this on sale for $20. At that price I would call this a fair deal if we could host a game just for friends. We can't, so if that sounds like the kind of sad total waste of your time that you don't want to deal with, avoid this game until many years from now when they finish it, assuming they even will.
developer_response:
Hi Unicron! 

First of all, thank you for taking the time to write this review.
We're sorry you're not satisfied with the game. 
As we are still in early access, there is still a lot of work to be done but as we are getting closer to the inevitable 1.0 release we will be entering the polishing phase fairly soon. That's when we'll revisit all the features/mechanics in need of balancing and fine-tune them as much as possible so they compliment each other. That includes additional animations, bug fixes, QOL changes, and a lot more.
That's what our goal from the very beginning was. 

And yes, we are aware that the game has a steep learning curve with HC realism, but that's the main draw for many players, myself included. It takes some time to get the hang on everything that you can do in the game. The tutorial we released as part of the last major update, 0.95,  has been requested for a long time and the reception we got was great! 

I would recommend that you try out some private servers with boosted loot and various tweaked settings which make the game a bit easier and forgiving. 
You're not limited to only officials servers or single player (which is also going to be fine-tuned for solo play)
I also have to mention that the level design team is planning on adding A LOT more variety to the residential buildings and houses all over the Island. All part of the polishing phase :)

As for the DLC's, they are COMPLETELY  optional and have no effect on gameplay. 
You can access all the features in the game without them. 

With all that said, please keep in my mind that we are a small team with a huge project and we have to manage resources (people) carefully, sometimes that means prioritizing one aspect over the other and often we are working outside of our working hours to get everything done. 

Thank you for giving the game a try, we hope you'll revisit it and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045343839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 50812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48271, 'last_played': 1706233047}
review:
0.95 added the fantastic mechanic where you shoot a zombie with a bow in a small town, and immediately get swarmed by 10 puppets who magically appear with 20 ft of you. Its super fun. Especially when you clear an enclosed room, check you inventory for a sec and turn around to a beeper and 2 other puppets who spawned INSIDE with you. That's cool. Sniping is dead, scouting and planning ahead is dead, and any immersion it had is dead. Everything is empty and devoid of life until you walk in and BOOM. Puppets all around you.

Used to be fun, played hell outta this game before. I hope you enjoy archery or melee (which is still garbage) b/c thats really all that might give you a shot if you don't have 100's of rounds for a rifle. 

A lot of the survival mechanics are vastly improved, but lord did they take one giant dump over that the new spawning system. Go play zomboid or something if you want that experience
developer_response:
Hi Rigatony222!

Thank you for taking the time to write this review.
We're sorry you're unsatisfied with the game. The team is aware of the issues surrounding stealth, hordes and the horde spawns, and are working on a fix.

As the 0.95 was the last major update, we will be entering the polishing phase soon where we'll revisit all features/mechanics and balance them out so they complement each other effortlessly.

Please be patient as we are still in early access with a small team and have to manage our resources (people) carefully, and this is a huge undertaking of a project. 

We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

review: screw this stupid game. after all the updates and all the time fixing issues there is still a huge issue with the map not loading fast enough in cases when driving. instead of just not loading textures, the ground itself will not load and i cant recount how many times ive fallen through the ground while driving and lose everything, all of my items unrecoverable. it is extremely frustrating to work for hours gathering resources and not even losing them to other players or actually crashing but to a problem that has yet to be fixed after years of being in beta. and this game is about to be released fully. screw this game, 0/10 buy DAYZ instead, dont waste your time
developer_response:
Hi Tristanrushton! 

Thank you for the valuable feedback.
Sorry to hear about your issues with the game. Did you try installing the game on a SSD/Nvme drive? It works a lot better, texture stream faster and it is listed in the system requirements. 
Is your configuration up to the task? 
Having said that, we are aware of those issues but some of them are very hard to reproduce in our conditions, even with simulating fake lag and what not. 
But the team is working tirelessly to fix those issues so players like yourself can enjoy the game. 
Since we've released the last major update 0.95, we'll be entering the polishing phase fairly soon where we'll revisit all the features/mechanics and fine-tune them so they complement each other. Bugs are reported and fixed on a daily basis so that when 1.0 is released it's as bug/issue free as possible!
We sincerely hope you'll give the game another chance and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990917558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1704650735}
review:
Ich habe mir dieses Spiel gekauft, da es angeblich das Tollste Survival Game sein soll.
Da muss ich wiedersprechen, mich hat noch kein Spiel in den ersten 2 Stunden so gefrustet wie Scum.
Somit hab ich mal eben 44 Euro in den Sand gesetzt, musste mir ja das Grosse Packet kaufe. Shit Happens.
Der Einzelspielermodus ist absoluter Müll.
Das Spiel ist absolut nicht Einsteigerfreundlich, kein vernünftiges Tutorial, hier wird alles Extrem. Das hat mit Spielspass nichts mehr zutun. Als Anfänger in eine Stadt zu gehen um sich Trinken zu besorgen kann man vergessen. Der Loot ist eine Katastrophe, sobald ein Puppet nur ein Furz lässt stehen gleich mal 10 Stück hinter im. 
Ich schliesse mich den vielen anderen Negativen Bewertungen an.
Kann dieses Spiel nicht Empfehlen.
Am besten Finger weg von dem Spiel und spart euch die Kohle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198995876342', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 52265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2640, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1712417161}
review:
The game seems really fun if you have the 10's of hours it seems needed to learn the basics of the game. I bought this game hoping it was like rust, 7 days to die, Project zomboid and finally DayZ but without the uninformed learning curve. I want to play all these games but i dont have the time or attention span to learn that i need to turn a rock into a knife then cut a bush, chop the logs into sticks, then into smaller sticks, then cut more into rope and a make shift rag and still battle the elements....just to make a freaking stone axe?  Too many clicks for to few rewards. It is a very grind your life away type game from what i have gather.

In 3 hours of play time, i have done nothing but get myself a makeshift - axe, stone knife, weak bow, 10 arrows, small bag that can hold absolutely nothing, cut my clothing into rags to make dirty bandages to fix my heavy bleeds i sustained from a puppet as soon as i landed and now night time is coming. I have no shelter, no tools for a shelter, no knowledge on how to make a shelter. I spent an entire day just getting a bag, wood cutting axe and a bow with limited arrows. My food and water is at 30/100 and im surrounded by Puppets i cant kill.

If you play rust or Dayz and are familiar with those game mechanics and crafting style this game will be great for you.

If you're trying to enjoy the content style Dayz and rust have to offer without the STEEP STEEP learning curve, this game is no different than them. 


Tl;Dr: Learning curve is 10's of hours like Dayz, rust, project zomboid. If you were expecting to get a taste of those games content from this game with an easier learning curve; this isnt the game for you.


I would like to see the devs put more effort into making the learning curve of the game more enjoyable, whether that be through tutorial missions or a seperate map without the dangers. As it is right now, the game is "drop you into a cold hostile zone with nothing and grind your first day away making a butter knife"

author: {'steamid': '76561198265182446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 3031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2988, 'last_played': 1704412283}
review: I will be honest I was playing Dayz and then played this one , I think this game is more organized than Dayz , Dayz is super complicated to build a home to find a rock everything is complicated at least in this one is easier to know what to craft and that a bug plus for me but the downside for me on this game even when I like it is this... I love the single player aspect this game have something that Dayz dont have I really appreciate that and I tried to play my single player game with my friends and it seems I cant play cooperative with them that from a 80//100 went down to a 40/100 then I decided to play online in a random server ok lets try I make a storagebox and it says will be deleted in 14 days... so why do I play this online so all my resources get deleted in 14 days??... like this put my 40/100 to a 0/100. Why I cannot  create a single player account and make online public if I desire??? or even play cooperative with my friends?? why?? why not?? I think this game needs more freedom on how I want to play the game, I know in Dayz there nothing of this but honestly I can at least defend myself on this one and not die 10 minutes later like I do in Dayz because I cant find a rock and make a knife that is really ridiculous, but I scumm you can actually find a rock something that I really appreciate , guys more freedom for the gamers let me play cooperative with my friends in my single player account , let me use my single player account to play online if I desire and those storebox online that dissapear 14 later... really? why are we talking about this?... that shouldnt happen... if things change I will change my review... for now will be like this...
developer_response:
Hi Zolitaryo!

Thank you for taking the time to write this review.
You cannot transfer a single player character to a server because you'd have a great advantage over other players. Imagine leveling up your SP character to the max and just jumping in on a server. Wouldn't be fair to other players. 
There's a single player for a PVE experience, you play solo. 
There's multiplayer where each character you made and used on a different server is stored on that server. 
Implementing what you want would require significant changes in the source code of the game and I don't think that is gonna happen. 
But you can always join a solo/duo server and play alone or with one friend. 
I would also recommend that you try out some private servers with a friend. 
Thank you again for the feedback, we hope you give you the game another chance and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024550923', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 204891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5095, 'playtime_at_review': 195338, 'last_played': 1712495260}
review: A big time sink.  It takes a long time to really develop your character.  However, due to the prevalence of hacking/cheating, your actual 'time' is stolen.  The developers will not address the issue on official servers.  After 3000 hours (can't say I didn't try), it's time to move on to another game that hasn't been in EA for six years.  Additionally, the game trailers are completely misleading.
developer_response:
Hi Silent! 

First of all, thank you for taking the time to write this review and for the many hours you played the game. 
We're sorry for the issues you've encountered with the game and we understand your frustration.
The hackers/cheaters are an issue we take extremely seriously and our team often works outside of their working hours to bring them down. 
We are still in early access, but we're getting closer to the inevitable release of 1.0. 
That means we'll be entering the polishing phase fairly soon where we'll revisit all features/mechanics that need fine-tuning and do our best to balance them out. 
That also includes updating the anti-cheat system. 

We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963243408', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 14733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12451, 'last_played': 1706922152}
review:
Guys..... this game..... hands down, another ridiculous survival game! If you've been watching my twitch or kick streams recently you'll see a bunch of my base building, gardening and cooking, car upgrading, an assortment of gun upgrading and customization gameplay. If not be sure to alt-tab over and check out twitch.tv/dubido or kick.com/dubido to get a small glimpse at some of the new 9.5 updates (12/21/23) that "The Devs" have released. 
I first started playing this game back in 2019 when it was first released.. ish.. and loved it. Even though it was an early access game back then it felt like a full game. There was a huge map to explore, tons of cool and interesting crafting options, all kinds of neat gear to loot and find, vehicles to find and fix up and drive and fill up with all sorts of gear. Usually for me, in "zombie games" when they can run as fast as you and take multiple hits from your weapons unless your actually aiming for the head. I'm talking about the amazing end graphics and the realism and heart pounding moments when the zombies are on your ass. Usually in zombie games, for some reason I for real get scared lol. I know chicken right.. I'ts okay, I just tell my self I'm saving my real heat attack for when something like a zombie apocalypse like 28 Days Later or Dying Light happens.
 
Needless to say this game strives for realism. Down to the calories and vitamins your in taking affecting your stamina, constitution and all sorts of stats.. I'ts actually almost too in depth tbh. But I like it. You'll burn hours without even trying. The amount of zombies and the intensity was actually not too bad for me so I was able to put some time into the game. In the new update the zombies can now actually jump through windows and break down doors and that put my anxiety to the next level lol and I'm sure that's what the developers were looking to do for all those seasoned players out there. 
But anyways, back when I first started playing this game I was able to get up to a point where I had survived for so long, had a truck full of all the guns and gear I'd need to survive. I turned my back for a few minutes to kill a deer for some food I had left my truck too close to a supply drop. The supply drops give you a chance to get some awesome gear that you would not otherwise been able to get and give you a little more of and edge to survive. They have a countdown before they self destruct and explode and when this one that I had just cleared blew up it took my truck and everything in it :'(. I rage quit then and there. I managed to clip the moment on twitch so it would haunt me for ever because I was ready to never play again.. 

Now, 4 years later I decided to pick the game back up and play it with some friends and I'm having a blast. I'm not big into the  PVP aspects of these types of games because of raids and looting other players things, especially after you've put hours and hours into a game and then someone comes along, robs and destroys everything you have, one random day, while your offline and at work in real life trying to pay the bills JUST KILLS all of the enjoyment of the game for me. 
I was able to find a PVE public server with an awesome admin team and discord server and have managed at this point to put just over 207 hours into the game. Thanks to these friendly and super helpful people that I've met on this server I'm learning so much more about the game I either didn't get to experience or try or that has come out in updates since I first played.

So regardless if you are into PVP or PVE this game has huge potential and I can see why even after 5 years of being out its still under development. If you haven't played, I highly suggest it if you into survival game. It has a PUBG feel with regards to graphic and weapons. A Rust or ARK feel in the PVE and PVE aspect and is its own mutated zombie creature when it comes to crafting, food/ cooking/ metabolism and in my eyes #1 in a zombie survival game.

Thanks for reading if you made it this far,
I appreciate you taking the time.
Please leave a like and or a comment. Let me know what you think.
Also if you didn't already, check me out on twitch, Kick & YT.
Thanks guys!
Dub

review: I really have enjoyed this game till the recent update. An explosive puppet plus 6-7 other puppets spawned directly on top of me when i was in my inventory. This update delivered broken spawning mechanics with no motivation to continue when you die. Giving your audience no hope to get anywhere, broken zombie stamina, puppets and mechs have wall hax, so discouraging, arguably unplayble right now. I hope the devs see the recent outrage of the community and try to change it. its sad
developer_response:
Hi Tyrant! 

First of all, thank you for writing this review, for your support, and for your honest feedback!  
Yes, the team is aware of the horde spawning issues and is working diligently on producing a fix. 
Your voice and the voices of the community have been heard. Please be patient as we are a small team and still in early access, but we're working as hard as we can to improve the game as much as possible. We'll be entering our polishing phase fairly soon where we'll revisit all the features in need of fine-tuning or rebalancing and address those issues.
We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind! 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198304424467', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1566, 'last_played': 1704714269}
review:
If you're thinking this is a PVP game then you'll be slightly disappointed.  It does have dozens of PVP servers and the game has all the PVP elements but it is primarily a PVE game with PVP bolted on.

Most of your time will be spent looting.  Around 70% i'd say.  The rest will be spent travelling, base building, and trading unwanted stuff.

This game is more of a survival simulator.  It has punishing mechanics which'll kill you if you're not aware of them, and enough dangers to keep you on your toes.  Add in PVP and you WILL feel the lose of all your work.

I recommend this game because it is by far the most realistic survival game I've come across.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018552611', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 7835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7227, 'last_played': 1705023132}
review:
Game has it's flaw, but pretty solid. It's so close to be the ultimate survival game and should borrow some features from other game out there.

Played 120h on v095, PVE only with friends.  
Encountered some bugs like stuff falling under containers when equipping directly from it. Player corpse disappearing after death from time to time. Puppets spawning out of thin air in our face or inside room we just cleared.  Melee hitbox not registering quite often(mostly with knives). Battery vanishing from battery charger.
Got stuck in the floor in some area with sentinels (friends had to punch me to get me unstock lol)
 
Insane skill grinding.
Game is lacking PVE content a little bit and would love to see some kind of missions. Escort, fetch, rescue, doesn't need to be too complicated. 
Fighting non-puppet NPC would be so cool.

In PVE there is no point in upgrading the base and twig is fine. I think that need to change and an optional game mode similar to 7days to die with horde coming to you at night or something like that would be a good incentive to improve base defense. It could scale difficulty based on fame point.  

Weed growth in garden is insane and should be tuned down, or give a huge buff to weed repellant.  
I liked the cooking system, but it could use some QoL, dragging item one by one on a recipe of 10 ingredient is tedious. Merging stack like we do for bullets is a must or you get stuck with ton of 2/10 stack you can't use. Shift + click to transfer items over container to recipe should be bare minimum.

when switching firing mode on riffles, I couldn't see what mode I was on most of the time, the switch is outside the screen most of the time. It should show on the gun icon on the toolbar like it does when looking at the number of bullets.

Loot quality vs risk felt off quite often. Mostly in POI guarded with sentinel, giving the same loot as the police station while some other POI gave military stuff for free (the school and basket ball court in the big city near C3).  

Melee weapon damage felt off and could use a rework. We should see some kind of indicator. An axe taking 5-6 hits to kill a puppet and a cleaver taking only 2 hits. Chainsaw taking 5-6 hit, while a bayonet is one-shotting every puppet. 

More animals would be nice, we didn't bother once with the hunting minigame. I tried a few time and never found anything.
Wolf and bear were pretty cool, but encounters happened very rarely.

Vendor should sell screw drivers in PVE or at least be a setting easy to change in the server settings sell screw driver= true or false...

Water well need a buff... that thing was constantly dry just from the cooking recipe. 

Cleaning cloth was tedious and required wayyyy too much soap. We didn't even bother cleaning dirty piece of gear and just eat antibiotic instead to deal with infections.
This could be fixed by allowing us to wash cloth with water only (soap making it quicker), or using like 2 use of soap to clean 100% (I think it's currently 1 unit for 10%).

Painting vehicules would be awesome...

author: {'steamid': '76561197996056681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3396, 'last_played': 1705078993}
review: It has the makings of a great survival game, but the hoard system is killing it.  Guns are basically useless except for PvP at this point.  Any noise spawns more zombies than you can deal with with melee.  Firing a gun to defend yourself makes more of them.  Eventually i stopped caring about exploring because the stuff i'd want to find, i can't really use.  If they get rid of this mechanic, or modify it in a way that's more playable, i'll come back.
developer_response:
Hi Nighthawk! 

Thank you for your honest feedback and support!
The team is aware of the issues regarding the horde system and spawning. We are investigating them thoroughly and working on a fix. 
Please be patient; we are still in early access, but a fix is coming. 
We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198378003274', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1709209480}
review:
В общем решил я рзнаобразить свои DayZовские деньки, решив купить SCUM, к которому давно приглядывался
Расскажу вам история
Первый и имхо единственный недостаток, малое количество онлайна на нормальных пар серверах, в целом мало годных серверов, опустим этот момент и перейдем к сути
Механики это огонь, глоток свежего вина в мире выживания для меня
Тоже пропустим эту тему, и перейдем к истории
Предисловие, отзыв высказан после всех возмущений об населенности серверов
Поиграл я ещё в scum, нашел адекватный серв с адекватным онлайном, причем пользовательский, не суть это, возьмём во внимание пару фактов этой игры, огромная карта и механики, поиграв ещё чутка, я понял, что онлайн и населенности сервака вовсе не важна в этой игре, потому здесь есть соло режим, почему, потому что людей на столь ебнуто огромной карте по меркам ДейЗа хуй встретишь, по классике в трейдзонах, но тебя здесь будут ебать вовсе не люди, а фауна этого мира, зомби в этой игре это пиздец опасность, это тебе не дейзовчкие полупокеры бегающие и особо не дамажащие, максимум нанесут тебе рваную рану не более, здесь это ебаная машина, каждого ты боишься как первого, к ним вернёмся позже, лут, по классике весь воен лут можно найти либо в полицайках в городе, либо в бункерах, либо на авиа базах, в основном бункеры и пару пушек в полицайке, ты весь такой весёлый на опыте ДейЗа идёшь в полицайку в городе, пробрался по стелсу вокруг тех двух зомби во всем городе, думаешь "отлично, теперь то я полутаюсь" но вдруг тебя замечает всего один зомбик во, который случайно оказался рядом, он начинает орать, ты думаешь "Ну ладно в дейзе крик пустое место, щас его ебну и все будет хорошо" но хуй там плавал, этот полупокер не просто так орет, он призывает своих братьев полупокеров, которые бегают как ебнутые, а у тебя из оружия дай бог мотыга, которая дамажит как дилдо порваный, но один ебучий зомби тебе сносит ебало накидывая на тебя раны обычные и тяжёлые, ты вспоминаешь, что в городе было всего два зомби, но ты видишь не два, не три зомби, а сука 10 хуй пойми откуда появившихся уебков, хорошо подумал ты, щас забегу в доме закроюсь и буду чилить, в дейз же помогает, а хуй там плавал, эти уебки способны не только открыть обычную дверь, но они способны открыть металлическую ебануто огромную дверь в бункер, которая без карточки не открывается никак, ладно похуй на двери подумаешь ты, убежишь повыше, хуй там плавал, вокруг уже 15 зомби и каждый из них лезет через окно и пиздит тебя, хоп ты сдох, хорошо, реснусь и заживу хорошо щас ты подумал, ага отлично, побежал лутаться, зашёл в бункер, ни вокруг бункера ни на входе не было ни одного зомби, ходишь лутаешь, хуяк вылазит один, оглянулся что бы убежать назад, бежишь, смотришь, хуяк их 10 зажали тебя у выхода и хуярят убивая за секунду, ладно думаешь, побежишь по деревням и сёлам, акуратно бегая лутая, бежишь бежишь, хуяк один зомби в деревне тебе по ебучке надавал, ты его убил, но он тебя отпиздил так что у тебя четыре раны с1 и две раны с2 которые сами по себе никак не пройдут, а ни бинтов ни тряпок у тебя нет, бум ты помер, реснулся, думаешь ну щас я больше никогда к зомби не подойду, бегаешь бегаешь, хуяк ты заболел, заболел сука инфекцией какой-то дай бог простудой, а таблеток у тебя конечно нет, и обычная простуда сама по себе как в нашей рашен федерейшен не прошла, она переросла в пневмагию, туберкулёз, а денег у тебя нет, как и лута который ты можешь продать, и купить антибиотики, и хуяк ты уже на 7 небе лежишь в аду мертвым, в общем здесь ты будешь от всего вокруг умирать в сотню раз больше чем от игроков, с которыми проще закентиться и строить базку попутно лутая бункеры

review:
Хороший аналог DayZ де можна пісяти й какати і не тільки.
Правда є недоліки після яких я вже декілька разів видаляв гру, наприклад, у бункері коли в одній частині зачистив локацію від зомбі, пішов чистити в іншу, вертаєшся і знову треба чистити бо вони переспавнились, якщо вистачить набоїв і ліків щоб зализати рани від попередньої зачистки це можна зробити, але Я В БУНКЕР ЗАХОДЖУ ЩОБ ОКУПИТИСЬ В РЕСУРСАХ А НЕ СПУСКАТИ ВСЕ НА БЕЗКІНЕЧНИЙ РЕСПАВН ЩОБ ПРОСТО ВИЙТИ З ТОГО БУНКЕРА ГОЛИМ І БОСИМ.
Надіюсь гра вийде в хорошому вигляді, бо те що зараз не ідеал але близько до цього.

author: {'steamid': '76561199040901304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 40497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37832, 'last_played': 1706416918}
review:
UPDATE (still do not recommend): I continued to play for a bit assuming the backlash from the previous update would elicit some serious action by the devs. To the dev's credit a fraction of those bugs were resolved. But they have been replaced by new ones. Not only that but now I get fatal error crashes that did not previously happen. Does it sound like the game is getting better? 5 years in early access? Funny enough, 6 months ago I would have recommended this game when I was playing almost everyday.

Aside from the fact the game is barely playable at the moment, these fixes also tend to make QOL changes that remove enjoyable features like riding a bike. After the 30 seconds it takes to deplete stamina when riding a bike, you simple stop pedaling. My character can run for twice as long on foot with 45 kg of gear. I can run faster and farther on foot than on a bike. How does that make sense? Just remove the bike instead of making it useless. I'm actually irritated at how sloppy that change is. And finally this experience has helped cement the idea that if an EARLY ACCESS game has multiple DLCs beyond reasonable supporter packs, then the game is fair game for higher scrutiny. I don't mind supporting EA releases, but the ones I've played with DLCs give me a sickly suspicion that the devs are actually just ivy league MBAs figuring out how to milk their market rather than an artist or a storyteller.

This game, Scum, feels less and less like a passion project and more like the product of some corporate think-tank.

FIRST REVIEW (did not recommend): 
I loved this game and played basically non-stop since last summer. I feel the horde update is so jarringly different that it has spoiled the fun. Stealth and camouflage skills are absolutely useless now. The puppets spawn right on top of you, and even if not, there's always one that spawns in and no matter where or what happens this one puppet will find you even if you run through bushes. When it finds you, it triggers a horde. Doesn't matter if it's a silenced gun, bow/arrow, or melee. Once you kill it, it triggers a horde. And if you've managed to clear a POI, you only have a few seconds before the puppets start spawning in again. Bears, wolves, and boars also spawn right on top of you. 

This update brought about the worst bug so far too. Pulling items from a storage chest have a chance to despawn the items. Yes, bug reports will say the item goes under the storage chest and to move it. I do every time! I move the storage, see the item, and it falls through the ground before I can do anything.

I love the server that I'm on but this update has broken me out of the game. The devs focus on realism in really innovative ways but this update has basically undone that by giving it an arcade feel. Is it going to be *immersive survival horror* or another arma 3 copy? In the game's current state, being a solo player is impossible. Stealth tactics don't matter even with adv skills. So it's a team-oriented shoot em up game with a sprinkle of survival elements.
developer_response:
Hi Ioquillo jiu jackaloo! 

Thank you for taking the time to write this review and for the supportive words.
We are sorry this last update brought you dissatisfaction with the game.
Since we are still in early access, bugs, crashes and other issues are to be expected. Also the reason why we check player reviews and comments on a daily basis. We appreciate your feedback! 

Having said that, there are some issues with the horde spawning that the team is aware of and they are being thoroughly investigated. 
And yes, we are aware of the chest bug. It's just not that easy to reproduce it in our conditions, even with fake lag (I've tried it multiple times). But our team is on it and they'll get it done. 

The 0.95 was the last major update before 1.0. That means that we'll be entering our polishing phase fairly soon so we'll be revisiting all features that need fine-tuning, rebalancing and hashing them out. We are aware that the game needs a lot more work and we're ready for it.
That also includes making the game more user friendly for solo players. But keep in mind, there are officials solo/duo servers which you can try if you're so inclined. 
We really hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind! 
Thank you for keeping it respectful! 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198152351753', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9053, 'last_played': 1704175361}
review:
挂太多太多了，小蓝熊就是摆设，淘宝随便搜搜，月销加起来好几千，快上万，这游戏一共有多少中国玩家嘛，真的挂多。
玩过squad，arma3，warthunder，CS等等，第一人称射击游戏加一起五千多小时。PVP模式比较类似的arma3和squad加起来有三千多小时，丝瓜国服不说一局30杀，平均十几杀还是做得到的，平均KD也在2-3以上，我自己觉得，菜绝对是不菜的，但在人渣里基本属于食物链底层，玩了一百多小时基本是重复收集物资，白给，收集物资，白给，无限循环。
今天埋了几个箱子也被刨了，彻底没脾气了。不玩了，但是还得说说我玩一百多小时遇见多少挂。
官服公屏自己大喊自己是挂哥，秒炼体8555的，用挂制裁另一个挂，互相指责对方开了，被杀以后报用户名的，死斗里KD5以上，永远绕到你身后偷你屁股的，闪现加速陀螺，各种秒开锁抄家等等等等……
这还只是你能看得见的挂，至于开个物资显示，透视或者脚本，你看不到的有多少，难以想象。
如果能加强反作弊，加大抄家难度，降低一些死亡惩罚，游戏再优化一些，应该是个好游戏，就现在来说，反作弊形同虚设已经让人失去兴趣了。
Too many cheaters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145466096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4113, 'last_played': 1704200333}
review:
Ich habe das Spiel von meinem Freund geschenkt bekommen und finde es bisher recht gut gemacht. Es ist an einigen Stellen noch nicht ganz so ausgereift, wie man es sich wünscht. (Early Access Bugs etc..). Hier und da gibt es natürlich auch mal mehr oder weniger Frust. Wenn man sich jedoch recht klug anstellt, vorsichtig ist und gut im Team zusammenarbeitet, dann ist das Spiel echt super und interessant und man kommt auch ein wenig herum :)

Aber alles in allem, macht es recht viel Spaß gemeinsam zu spielen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066258093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1704169407}
review:
It's so beyond me how anyone enjoys this game.  I can not find one redeeming thing about it. I think I bought it on a deep sale. I played single player only. 

On the technical side, I'm getting so much pop-in from flora textures, at varying distances too. Some of this is happening almost right next to me. I'm getting a decent amount of stuttering too. I've tried on different settings as well. I'm playing on a RTX 2070. So right off the bat you have this distracting shit happening that messes with my head and makes me anxious. 

The gameplay is immensely boring. Project Zomboid moves at a much better pace and that moves slow but it's fine. There is a steep learning curve that will involve doing actual work and research well beyond an average complex game. The game tells you little and you don't even get all the keybindings in the options so you have to look online for all the hotkeys. This is crazy and shows little respect for the player. 

There is no narrative whatsoever (this is probably obvious but still, there is zero, so more boring)

Combat is horrible but I didn't find any ammo yet. Melee combat is low tier jank, I can't imagine gun play being fun. 

Looting is horrible. I get it, there's scarcity, but you search soooooo many containers and usually get nothing and carryweight is very tough. Item size makes no sense sometimes. Small items can be way too big. So when you do find random materials and whatnot you're not carrying it anyway. I came across two bikes with no front tire. Wow, really making me work for that, huh? The map is huge, give me a break.  You also find stuff in random places, I assume scripted, to help create game flow but it feels artificial and unimmersive. Like ok, you played long enough and suffered so you can get a backpack now, or whatever. 

Enemy variety is weak. What's the deal with these giant mechs that guard what I assume are military bases? You can't really tell what they are, just large points of interest. They feel way too out of place. There was this random laughing guy that blows himself up on you. What the heck is that? Dumb. The zombies themselves have a low variety as well. Like shit man, if that's the main enemy make more clothing.  

Script spawning feels off. I'll look around an area, see and hear nothing, and then I'm in a house, crouching and being quite and then I have four zombies running towards me out of nowhere. They spawn randomly in the field too. I cleared a farm house and then another spawned within minutes right there, and then another. Bad scripted spawning is a game killer for me. Just like State of Decay 2.  

Map design is uninspiring and bland. Relating to loot, what happened to all the stuff?? Buildings are barren and feel so random. 

Crafting. I never got to craft anything and it's another game that has you chopping down trees. Crafting looks tedious and the menu navigation needs help.  

Skills. I didn't have much chance to use any skills. This system seems fine enough for a survival game. 

Sound design is serviceable. 

Even if you like the slow moving survival zombie genre, I can't understand enjoying this game.
developer_response:
Hi Bianculli Joseph! 

First of all, thank you for taking the time to write this review! 
We're sorry you're unsatisfied with the game. 
Let's dive in! 

1. The texture pop-in is waiting for us to move into the polishing phase so the level design team can optimize/replace textures all over the Island.
Also, try lowering the details to HIGH and setting streaming speed to high or very high. 
The 2070, although it has 8GB VRAM would struggle on 1440p. I don't know which resolution you're playing in but try working around some of the settings. 

2. The gameplay involves HC realism which is a main draw for many players, including myself. 
Yes, the learning curve is steep but we've added the tutorial codex in the 0.95 update which contains info on all the game mechanics and useful tips. I'm curious, what controls are you talking about, that are not listed in the controls menu? 

3. With the 1.0 release, we are planning to add missions and side quests, which will provide a certain narrative element. Also, armed NPC's patrolling the Island and points of interest. 

4. Melee combat is also waiting for it's rework in the polishing phase, we realize it's one of the weaker parts of the game. A shame that you didn't stick around to find a firearm, we actually have one of the most realistic ballistic simulations in our game, and the gunplay is on point. 

5. Looting has been rebalanced but it's still not perfect. Some people want more loot, others want less. Finding that balance is often tricky but we're doing our best.
In the meantime there are many private servers you can try out with increased loot/vehicles. 

6. We've added new enemy types in one of our last updates, so it's not only zombies who are a threat now. Also, referring to the 3rd point, we are adding armed human NPC's and more enemy types with 1.0. 

7. Yes, we are aware of some issues with the horde system spawning and our guys are investigating it thoroughly. 

8. The map is inspired by Croatian landscapes and terrain, it's very much how homes used to look in Croatia. 
Having said that, the level design team will add a lot more variety to houses/buildings along with new textures and various optimizations. 

9. The crafting menu got an extensive overhaul and I'm surprised to hear you didn't craft anything. Especially with the new UI, which helps tremendously. 
I'd say that 2 hours is not nearly enough to get the whole SCUM experience. It's a game that you need to invest time in to reap the rewards, and it's worth it. 

Like I've said, we will address most of the issues you mentioned during our polishing phase, but the game is tested every day, bugs are reported and fixed on a daily basis. We are determined to make SCUM the best it can possibly be. 

Thank you for reaching out to us. We hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind.
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046919816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 12206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1709691040}
review: Wszystko byłoby lepsze gdyby gra miała normalny silnik a nie ten unreal engine. Przez to wygląda dziwnie, filmiki na YT tego nie oddają, ma się wrażenie, że grasz w okienkową grę w której wszystko musisz kliknąć i rozwijając menu dalej wybrać co chcesz zrobić. Jak dla mnie przez to rozwiązanie gra wydaje się drewniana bez intuicyjnego polotu. Mapa wydaje się dużo większa niż wygląda bo przemieszczanie po niej jest powolne. Nie da się grać na super ustawieniach bo silnik gry zużywa moce przerobowe kompa i nie ma znaczenia jak szybki masz kombajn. Postać dziwnie się porusza i nierealistycznie wysoko podskakuje. Mimo wszystko trzymam kciuki za rozwój tej pozycji. Można odnieść wrażenie, że takie DayZ w porównaniu ze SCUM wydaje się proste i błache w swej mechanice, SCUM ma o wiele więcej do zaoferowania i zawiera w sobie różne minigry których odkrywanie i uczenie się naprawdę daje frajdę. Eksploracja bunkrów, walka o zrzuty zaopatrzenia, czy poprosu łówienie ryb czy uprawa roślinności są dużo bardziej złożone niż to się wydaje. Dopiero niedawno odkryłem, że skradając się zmniejszamy ryzyko spawnu agresywnych zombie. Rozmiar mapy 15 km x 15 km, różne biomy, możliwość pływania i nurkowania w poszukiwaniu zatopionych itemów... każdy coś znajdzie dla siebie. Dla wytrwałych budowanie bazy.... i tak cie okradną bo tu sami SCUM grają :)

review:
Drowned with a bag full of ammo and guns. 
Needless to say my keyboard is in pieces and my mouse is embedded inside my wall.
Would rather play minecraft with my nipples hooked up to a car battery.
developer_response:
Hi DildoBaggins! 

Thank you for your feedback, we regret you're unhappy with the game. 
There's a section in the tutorial codex about diving while overloaded. 
You will drown if your backpack is too heavy, but you can drop it in the water and swim out to the surface, return for it later. 
We sincerely hope you won't resort to hooking up your nipples to a car battery, but hey, who are we to judge? :D 
We hope you'll revisit the game and hopefully change your mind!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006314440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5296, 'last_played': 1704146481}
review: The game is dead. The developers have been messing with core features in an attempt to add more content to sell more games and instead broke the game. Since I've come back to the game in 0.95 I can't survive longer than 10 minutes. I'll clear out an area of puppets, start looting and suddenly be swarmed by 15 puppets that came from nowhere. It's ridiculous.
developer_response:
Hi BushWookieActual! 

We're sorry to see you're not satisfied with the game. 

I can assure you, the game is not dead and it's closer than ever to the inevitable 1.0 release. 
We have a roadmap that we're sticking to, and sometimes that means changes to the game that players might initially not like. The core mechanics you speak of have been balanced, reworked, and new ones have been added. 
Yes, we are aware of some issues with the horde spawns, but our team is investigating the matter thoroughly. 
As we're heading to the 1.0 release, we'll be entering the polishing phase fairly soon, which we'll use to revisit any/all features and mechanics that require fine-tuning and rebalancing. 
We really hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind! 

Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064985418', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1721, 'last_played': 1681929815}
review: A really cool survival RPG that aims for immersion without hindering the player experience. Whenever a game tries to be super realistic it often does so at the expense of enjoyment, but I think SCUM does an amazing job of making a fun, immersive, and realistic survival experience that doesn't compromise on fun in the process. Would suggest you grab it on sale if you like survival shooters.

author: {'steamid': '76561199492499486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1703999085}
review: This game feels too unfinished for me to enjoy playing. Also seems they are trying to copy DayZ. I was personally not a fan. Might give it another chance later on but for now it obviously needs a lot more work. At least it was better than The Day Before...
developer_response:
Hi Misstrish!


Thank you for your honest feedback, we appreciate it. 
We are still in early access, so some bugs and strange issues are to be expected.
But, we'll be entering our polishing phase fairly soon and revisit all the features/mechanics that need rebalancing/fine-tuning and hash them all out. 
By the time 1.0 releases, the game will be in much better shape so we hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 

Have a great day!

1.Пустой мир - можно побродить и умереть))  лишь по локациям кто то есть
2.Умереть можно от всего, вода, жратва, витамины, при этом лутаться мало где и мало что выпадает, зомби умирают не сразу,
3.Недружелюбный крафтинг
4.Рюкзак, мне кажется самая нужная вещь

Можно бродить, искать и т. д. И умереть от потери крови, тряпкой не остановить))) 
В общем перемудрили со всем этим реализмом до маразма, даже по скидке 1167р, того не стоит, с пустым миром и вылетами, максимум 400-500р

review: It is currently one of my favorite games. There are still some improvements that need to be implemented before it becomes a perfect zombie survival game, such as new base construction modules like an advanced electricity system (photovoltaic panels), bulbs or other lighting sources, new vehicles, and new buildings or cities. These are just a few examples. Overall, the game shows a lot of promise and in my opinion, it is currently the number one multiplayer zombie survival game.

developer_response:
Hi CRO_Sokol! 
Thank you for your feedback, we appreciate it. 
The game DOES have a steep learning curve which is a draw for many players (myself included). But we've introduced the tutorial codex with 0.95 and it should make things a lot easier for new players.
 
There are many private servers with boosted loot settings so feel free to try out any of them, you're not limited to official vanilla servers only. 
We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind! 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561199216098562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8672, 'last_played': 1705852207}
review:
Jeu intéressant mais le système de horde et la dernière mise a jour n'ont aucune logique , les zombies sorte de terre ou apparaissent derrière toit ou dans la pièce ou tu est rentré en sécurité pour te soigner comme par magie que tu soit accroupi sans faire de bruit ou a courir partout et faire du bruit cela déclenche des hordes .
Pour un jeu de survie qui ce dit réaliste cela n'est en aucun cas réaliste et logique de faire sortir de terre des zombies.
Sur tous le reste le jeu reste correct mais leur système de horde et de spawn de zombies et nul et a retravaillé, sur ce point DAYZ est carrément mieux pour ce qui est des spawn de zombies en ville ou en base militaire, quand tu as nettoyer une zone cela ne reviens pas tant que tu ne quitte pas la zone alors que scum ils sortent de terre sans cesse et sans forcement de raison ou surtout de logique.
je reviendrai quand le jeu aura trouver une certaine logique au spawn de zombie et revu tous leurs système de horde qui gâche tous leu jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017280650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1704091518}
review: Two and a half hours to build a bed, only to find out that you don't respawn on said bed. Unless you use special in-game currency. How long do you think it will be before that is a microtransaction? Wasted potential. :(
developer_response:
Hi Tribantine! 

We're sorry to see you're unsatisfied with the game. 
Is there anything else that's troubling you with the game? 
It is a challenging game, with a steep learning curve and sometimes very unforgiving. But, that whole HC survival is what drew a lot of players to the game, myself included. 
Gold will no be a microtransactional resource, there are ways to get it. You just have to get a little creative :) 
We really hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072169262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 4455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1500, 'last_played': 1709104701}
review: Very overly tedious and frustrating. I lost my whole character because apparently the drop pods's explosions are as big as a nuclear explosion and the game doesn't tell you that. I wasted hours of my time just to get killed in a stupid bomb.
developer_response:
Hi Chin-Chin Chan! 

Thank you for your feedback. 
As with all mechanics in the game, we try to make them as realistic as possible while still being fun. 
In real life, the explosion and fatality radius is significantly larger than people think and that explosion from the cargo drop was reduced after initial testing because of its radius. 
We are still in early access so there's time to balance everything out and fairly soon we'll be entering the polishing phase to do just that - balance out every feature/mechanic that needs fine-tuning. 
We hope you'll be patient with us, revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198156373283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 96313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94206, 'last_played': 1704935213}
review:
"Scum" não é apenas um jogo de sobrevivência; é uma obra-prima que redefine o gênero. Desde o momento em que entrei neste mundo vasto e implacável, fiquei impressionado com a riqueza de detalhes e a complexidade que o jogo oferece.

Os gráficos realistas de "Scum" são de tirar o fôlego. Cada textura, paisagem e movimento são meticulosamente trabalhados, criando um ambiente imersivo que instiga a exploração. Os ciclos de dia e noite adicionam uma camada extra de desafio, mas também proporcionam visuais espetaculares que variam de amanheceres tranquilos a pôr-do-sol vibrantes.

A mecânica de sobrevivência é profunda e satisfatória. Gerenciar fome, sede e saúde nunca foi tão envolvente. A necessidade de procurar recursos e criar estratégias para enfrentar ameaças mantém a adrenalina em alta, proporcionando uma experiência de jogo autêntica.

A personalização de personagens em "Scum" é impressionante. Desde as habilidades até a aparência, cada detalhe pode ser ajustado, permitindo que os jogadores se expressem completamente no mundo do jogo.

O aspecto multijogador é excepcional, oferecendo uma interação dinâmica com outros sobreviventes. Seja formando alianças para enfrentar ameaças comuns ou competindo estrategicamente, a comunidade em "Scum" adiciona uma dimensão social única à experiência de sobrevivência.

A variedade de ambientes, missões e desafios mantém o jogo sempre intrigante. Cada sessão de jogo parece única, reforçando a ideia de que, em "Scum", a sobrevivência é verdadeiramente personalizada.

Em resumo, "Scum" não é apenas um jogo; é uma jornada intensa e emocionante. Se você procura um desafio de sobrevivência que transcende as expectativas, "Scum" é a escolha definitiva.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143762928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 22063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 9, 'playtime_at_review': 4458, 'last_played': 1711427117}
review: Nunca fui fã de jogos de sobrevivência, tentei jogar outros, mas os jogos nunca me pegaram pra valer, mas mesmo assim sei da capacidade desses jogos e todo o potencial deles, apenas nenhum deles conseguiu me prender. Com Scum foi diferente, por ser mais realista do que os demais, ter armas reais e ser um estilo de jogo único, eu decidi aprender, a ideia é essa, aprender o jogo estudar as maneiras de como você sobrevive e depois achar um servidor ativo. O jogo mudou meu modo de ver esses jogos de sobrevivência, o jogo é excelente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064443007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1704759165}
review:
Boobs and chainsaws- sometimes goats go brrr very gud.


Is what I would like to say, however. This game is hot garbage and not worth more than 3$ USD. Even then I could not condone playing this game for that price. The spawn system for zombies is absurd, enemy placement could have been thought out better by anyone other than the current devs its almost like they have literally never play tested this game. On top of that progression is about as logical as chewing on plastic explosive to cure cancer. An analogy that is as ludicrous as spending one more minute attempting to play this. Fix player bodies de-spawning, in literally every location imaginable, bunkers, outside, etc. Fix the scripts for enemy detection and spawning. Define entirely new parameters and you could consider this game "Pre-Alpha" Almost six years of development and this thing is about as a polished as a sea urchin in a sea of glass. I wanted to like this game but anything less than this much would be an understatement. Not a single mechanic past- ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, pissing and consuming food, reloading magazines- is anywhere near close to "intelligent design" as it would presumably like to be perceived as. It is most certainly a "Game" though. Great cash grab devs, rename it from SCUM to SCAM and you'll have at least been honest with your audience. Maybe in another 15 years this will be playable. PS I don't know how you managed to make unreal engine run like hot dog shit on a 3090 but you did. That alone is impressive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056366652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 7074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1842, 'last_played': 1706994602}
review: This game is currently unplayable with how often and how random puppets spawn. They spawn ON you, not at locations. Waste all your ammo on 10, and 10 more will spawn.
developer_response:
Hi Tyrael! Thank you for reaching out and writing this review. 
The team is aware of some issues with the hordes and unrealistic spawning, we are investigating the issues thoroughly. 
However, as we are still in early access, some issues and bugs are to be expected. 
We will also be revisiting every game mechanic in the polish phase, fine-tuning everything as much as we can to release 1.0 as the best version of the game it can be.
Thank you for your feedback, we hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198322598327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 25051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21794, 'last_played': 1706152652}
review:
Поиграв 300+ часов,решил написать обзор,сейчас объясню за что дизлайк игре:
Касается это последнего обновления,а именно орд зомби,порог вхождения в игру для кепок стал просто нереально высоким,невозможно лутать полицайки,а уж тем более военные бункера,про новые бункера не говорю(еще не заходил туда),зомби спавнятся чуть ли не на игроке и их становиться очень много,а у новичка огнестрельного оружия как всегда нет,даже если оно и есть,то шум от него соберет еще больше зомби,а стамины для милишного оружия не хватит ни у кого.От зомби теперь не спрятаться,они лезут в окна,выбивают двери,зомби С4 больше не взрываются на дистанции,и они замечают игрока на большом расстоянии,и пофиг в здании ты или нет.В общем интерес к игре пропал,т.к.начинать игру кепкой просто нереально.Пока что оценка "Не рекомендую",посмотрим что дальше будет,возможно дополню обзор.

review: Definitely  not recommended. The crafting system is stupid hard and tedious down to you need to craft a rope to make an ax which is bullshit if you have been a boy scout. The enemies are lack luster and offer no challenge. The biggest challenge in this game is finding food
developer_response:
Hi Halcyon! 

Thank you for your feedback, we appreciate it. 
Could you go into a little more detail? After the last update and the crafting rework, the reception to crafting was stellar and people love it! 
I have to say, since the last update we've heard very few people say that enemies offer no challenge. Have you gone to a village/city and triggered the horde? 
Have you gone to an abandoned bunker and try to outwit Razors and Mr. Brenner? 
Higher the risk, higher the reward :) 
We'll be entering the polishing phase of the development process fairly soon, that's when we'll revisit every feature and tweak it/balance it out as much we can!
In any case, we hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind.
Have a good one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198275068115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 21282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20786, 'last_played': 1708861761}
review: Bought this game when it came out. It had it's flaws, but like with DayZ I decided to wait. I had a great time on a rp-server few years ago, but always felt that it's way too easy for a survival game. You need the challenge to keep yourself interested, right? Anyway, came back to this since my bro got a pc and we can play together and bought this to him. Oh man I love the fact that the mutant puppets enter the buildings now! Haven't played the updated version a lot yet so I don't know what to say about the hordes, but the challenge is welcome. For people cursing them I heard that you just need enough distance to them and they will disappear (to keep the server smooth). Not sure if it works, but worth trying if you're stuck.

author: {'steamid': '76561199097017495', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1704047696}
review: Сделайте оптимизацию игры, это просто бред какой то, мои настройки: Intel core i5-9300H, GeForce GTX 1650 4Gb, оперативная память 16 Гб 3200, игра просто лагает при каждом повороте камеры при том, что игра на SSD в турбо бусте, даже в дейз картинка красивее и настройки у меня там средние стоят(70-100fps), а здесь дай бог 45fps на самых низких настройках при том, что дейз выглядит реалистичнее, ну неужели за столько лет нельзя сделать оптимизацию, я хочу играть в это, но просто не могу с таким fps, разрабы как будто забили на игру, а игра стоит на секундочку не копейки.

author: {'steamid': '76561198819748114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1679216228}
review: game has a lot of amazing features but don't expect to get them right away. its a little too daunting. You can load in solo and use cheat codes/spawn any items in the game which is honestly what I would recommend doing for a while. get yourself acquainted with all the mechanics. I like in depth and challenging but I would also like to be told what to do with what. All in all I will eventually get into this game again but everytime I turn it on I am reminded how much bs there is to learn and how much bs there is just to get to actually playing and enjoying the game. as a guy who likes rifles and ghillie suits I know I will be thrilled with my purchase eventually but right now it is just too much. I do recommend this product I just want people to know what they are getting into lol

author: {'steamid': '76561198353684697', 'num_games_owned': 20, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1704483234}
review: С дейзом и не сравнится, делать не чего от слова совсем, бессмысленные хождения туда сюда, лутание всякого говна без единого огнестрела, один только пистолет за 6 часов, и лук который сделал сам. Мир пустой, ходишь и не чего не лежит вообще, раз в 5 ящиков какие нибудь спички упадут. По карте просто так побродил, раз 5 сдох от зомби которые хуй знает откуда берутся в 10 ебал. Играть возможно еще буду, но уже жалко те деньги которые отдал за это!

author: {'steamid': '76561198208014461', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1706800627}
review: Не смотря на ранний доступ игре есть что предложить. Очень похожа на DayZ, но, как по мне, намного удобнее в плане управления и более продумана, как для игры. То есть в неё, несмотря на сложную систему взаимодействия с миром, в тысячу раз проще играть чем в DayZ, да и визуал приятнее. Контента на данный момент маловато. В начале кажется что его много и это затягивает, но после пары десятков часов заметно однообразие. Подслащает ПВП, но и пятая точка горит тоже знатно, иногда так что хочется удалить игру =) Зато эмоции.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372682156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3215, 'last_played': 1707520155}
review:
Dopo 50 ore di gioco posso dare la mia piccola impressione riguardo questo titolo:
SCUM è il connubio più malsano fra simulazione e sopravvivenza in un mondo pervaso dagli zombi. di per se la cosa non mi spiace affatto, anzi mi ha intrigato sin dal principio molto. infatti per un bel po ho testato le varie dinamiche che intersecano tutto il gameplay di gioco.
DETTO QUESTO.  PERCHE LA VALUTAZIONE E' NEGATIVA?
L'opzione delle Horde e la peculiarità dei Mecha, unito alla situazione inerente a fama e punti necessari per interagire col negozio. TUTTO CIO' ha reso la mia vita frustrante. 
Per fare un esempio. immagina di essere un marine ben addestrato, stai per entrare in una stanza, controlli con la coda dell'occhio angoli, mobili,  vie di ingresso e di uscita, ti prepari ad ingaggiare e dopo aver fatto tre passi nella stanza, sbatti le ciglia e ti ritrovi circondato da 4 ostili, in una stanza cosparsa di C4 e dove non ci sono piu ne porte ne finestre per uscire, BEH QUESTA E' L'ORDA PER COME L HO VISSUTA IO. Spawn randomici di non morti che ti portano continuamente a dubitare di ogni singolo e fottuto passo che fai, stanza che pulisci, o porta che chiudi.
A voi la possibilita di provarlo ma onestamente allo stato attuale per me è un NO!
Lo dico con forte dispiaciere ma difficilmente arrivo ad arrabbiarmi per un gioco se non quando questo si inventa delle regole dopo essersi dato un tono

author: {'steamid': '76561198097701037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 83541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1614, 'playtime_at_review': 74016, 'last_played': 1711991436}
review:
Ich hatte damals im August 2019 das Spiel als Early Access erworben, mit dem Gedanken, dass es im Laufe der Zeit schon erhebliche Fortschritte geben wird. Leider ist das Survival-Prinzip im Laufe der Zeit völlig in den Hintergrund geraden und es blieb in meinen Augen im Single-Player völlig langweilig. Es gibt da kaum sinnvolle Herausforderungen, da es kein wirkliches Ziel gibt. Bis heute (Ende 2023) wurde nicht ein Weg vorgesehen, die Insel verlassen können, den BCU zu entfernen (ohne den Kopf dabei zu verlieren) oder ähnliches. Man rennt seit 2018 bis heute (Ende2023) im Early Access eigentlich dumm auf der Insel rum, füllt tonnenweise Kisten mit allerlei nutzlosen Kram, hordet Dinge, die man zum Überleben nicht wirklich braucht und kann Dinge im Singleplayer craften, die keine Sinn ergeben. Kein Puppet durchbricht die dünnsten Wände einer Base oder zerstört billige Holztüren oder Fahrzeuge. Welchen Grund sollte man da also haben, Wände, Türen und Schlösser aufzurüsten oder überhaupt  eine mächtige Base zu bauen, wenn man seine Kisten auch einfach in einer Scheune deponieren kann. 
Ein weiterer massiver Schwachpunkt ist es, dass anfangs das Game unheimlich schwierig zu bewältigen sein kann und nach recht kurzer Spielzeit einfach viel zu einfach wird, da es keinerlei Ausgewogenheit im Spiel gibt, was die Puppets betrifft. Anfangs steht man mit einem simplen Speer, einer Steinaxt oder einem einfachen sehr schwachen Bogen schnellen und schlagkräftigen Puppets mit Panzerung oder Sprengsgürtel gegenüber, denen man schlicht durch rennen auch nicht entkommen kann.
Überlebt man die ersten Stunden und hat mit etwas Glück die passenden Waffen gefunden, wird's gegenüber den Puppets plötzlich viel zu einfach.
Nach so langer Entwicklungs-Zeit hat sich vom Spielablauf und den Herausforderungen nicht wirklich viel getan, was Survival-Fans glücklich machen könnte. 
Am Ende ist es ein sinnfreies Umherfahrenl/laufen an verschiedene Lootspots, um sich die Xte taktische Weste oder AK in die Kisten zu räumen, da es sonst nix gibt, was man auf der Insel sonst machen kann. Einen Weg davon runter ist ja bisher nicht vorgesehen. 

Im Multiplayer haben Einzelkämpfer keine Chance gegen Teams, da man in allem unterlegen ist. Bunker allein zu looten ist ineffizient, da man entweder nicht alles schleppen kann, was sinnvoll ist oder weil man schlicht nicht das findet, was einem eine Chance ermöglicht gegen mehrere Gegner überhaupt eine Chance zu haben. Gerade wenn diese nachts bereits über Nachtsichtgeräte verfügen, wo man selbst quasi noch im Dunkeln gelassen wird. Motivation findet man als Einzelkämpfer auch auf Multiplayer Servern nicht, da man da ständig komplett geplündert wird und man auch nie in der Lage ist, sich eine beständige Base zu bauen, da man alleine nie zeitnah die nötigen Ressourcen zusammentragen kann, bevor diese ebenfalls geplündert oder zerstört werden. Wer keine Lust hat auf Teams, der ist bei dem Spiel im Single-Player schnell gelangweilt und im Multiplayer eigentlich nur in orangenen Dress unterwegs, da man auf gut besuchten PVP-Server keine 30min Überlebenschance hat.

不建议购买！！！

妥妥的差评！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198111832120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 54588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54064, 'last_played': 1709056034}
review: too many hackers, cheaters the  game is unplayable. you spend many hours to collect loot then lose to cheaters.
developer_response:
Hi 龙王! 
We're sorry you're having issues with the game. 
Our team takes hackers/cheaters very seriously and our guys often work outside their working hours to bring them down. But we cannot ban people without sufficient evidence. Having said that, we're nearing the polishing phase where we'll revisit all the features/mechanics in need of rebalancing and hash them out. That also includes updating the anti-cheat detection software. 
We hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind! 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027914232', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1709, 'last_played': 1707155930}
review:
I find this game to be as accurate and as brutal as Project Zomboid, but immersive as a beautifully designed and crafted third person 3d game.
The crafting system is a jewel, combat is realistic and fun. Survival aspects are brilliant, and the whole aspect of metabolism is unbelievably realistic.
I am enjoying every hour of this game.
Find yourself a good ad healthy server and play there!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990434439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 8704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8704, 'last_played': 1703882609}
review:
My friends and I were enjoying this game for years with a simple concept; Spawn, loot, find each other, loot, find a place for a base, build it and loot some more until you die.

Now, the reason I cannot recommend this game (anymore) is because of the Horde mechanic/ new uodate.
In the past we were clearing a town before we would loot it. Of course there were "puppet" spawns every now and then, but nothing crazy, you would feel a little bit safe. Now they spawn in crazy numbers, can jump tall buildings, breach through doors and much more.

I used to play DayZ but found this game way more attracting because of the fact that the true enemy is not a puppet, but the environment and other players.

Now, I wouldn't mind "hordes" as the next guy, just make it so we can see them, not some stupid event where they suddenly come from everywhere.
developer_response:
Hi there =WFT= Eagle!  
First of all, thank you for taking the time to write this review. 
Thank you for being so supportive over the years! 
We are aware of some issues with the hordes and are investigating them thoroughly. As you know, we are still in early access and depend on player feedback to balance out the game as much as we can. So please be patient, we're working on it and hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind.
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009915492', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1680439040}
review: the game is fun when you have a group of friends or people that you can ally with in game. However it will take you anywhere from two to 50 hours to learn the game play. You need to take the time and learn all of the character/game mechanics. So i'd suggest that you watch some game play on youtube, or guides on how things work if you are having trouble. Just remember that you can't trust anyone in game that wants to team up on a raid, because they will most likely plan an ambush with their friends, and they will catch you when you guys leave the area. Also there are people who hold a grudge and won't stop making things difficult for your when you are online playing. Lol, people will literally camp and wait until you come online to kill you. even when you have nothing for them to loot and they are geared out. Just remember to utilize your environment when you have a raging little man syndrome mosquito pestering you. Run to a large clans base or use the NPCs to kill them, and watch them rage out even more, lol.
