review:
I have been playing scum for a while and with every new update it goes the wrong way, after the update with the horde i spawned somewhere near a police building location, had no chance with the zombies all over me opening doors now,they spawn out of the blue , sometimes get inside the buildings through doors and walls. If at the beginning of the game it was easy to reload a weapon , after some while you could only reload bullets in a magazine, well that sucks boys  .
Well that is hard core and not for me. Not anymore!
developer_response: Hi Tzuperboy! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that there are certain issues with the puppet spawns after the new update and you'll be pleased to know that we have tweaked this system so the puppets are spawning further away from the player. We've also buffed the damage melee weapons deal to puppets, meaning that you'll have a much better chance of survival against them before you manage to acquire a firearm. Regardless, the team here has their ear to the ground when these situations occur and react accordingly and we'll look into ways to further tweak this and other systems in order to facilitate as awesome of an experience for our players as possible. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561199378093128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1703408637}
review:
As another reviewer put it, "the devs care about the game, but not about the players."

This game does not have anything that even passingly resembles a meaningful tutorial. I felt like I was being actively punished for just trying this game, and I regret purchasing it.
developer_response: Hi Chadodoxy! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that the mechanics of the game could be better explained and that a dedicated tutorial would be more than beneficial - especially for new players. SCUM is still in Early access and we still have a lot of features, QoL improvements and content additions on the way before we fully release the game. We advise that you try to acquaint yourself with the game's mechanics by accessing the MANUAL submenu when you press TAB while in game. We acknowledge that the game may have a learning curve that is on the steeper side, but we'll make sure to address that as we'll be fully releasing the game and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we'll get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077357797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1703379492}
review:
2023/12/24　Ver0.95の感想です。

セールで購入しました。
他のサバイバル物とは一線を画する
健康に関する数値の細かさが売りの今作、
ちょっとさわってみた感じでもなかなか好感触ではあるんですが、
現状、ゾンビに見つかって叫ばれたり、
銃を撃つなどで大きな物音をたてると
プレイヤー周囲の視界外に
新たなゾンビがPOPするという仕様になっています。
建物内でのクリアリングがまったく意味をなさなくなる仕様で
掃除したとおもっていた行き止まりや、
今まさに自分が通ってきた背後からゾンビが沸いて
背中から殴られるという少々理不尽な状況になっています。
銃が自由に使えるようになって以降なら、
銃の音に対するペナルティという部分で納得？
（でも何もないところにゾンビ沸くのは違うとも感じる
ゾンボイドや7DTDみたいに
遠くのやつが音に反応して近寄ってくるならわかるけど…）
できなくもないのですが、
ゾンビに見つかって叫ばれたら発生という
最序盤でも余裕で起こりうる条件の緩さと、
装備が整うまでのきつさもあり、
始めたばっかりの初心者には少々敷居が高く感じました。
というわけで、この仕様が改善されるまでは
人におススメできるような状態ではないと感じました。

author: {'steamid': '76561197967501070', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1703378897}
review:
Tutorials are poor, to say the least. Every once in a while a pop up would show up on the side of the screen for a brief few moments, then disappear. No way to get them to return, that I could find, so I just often found myself scrolling through the keybinds menu to figure out what I am supposed to press. One (unhelpful) tutorial was to let me know that if I am finding lots of empty search items, perhaps another player has been there. That's great, but I'm single player. Who else is around to loot them? No, they're just all empty by design.

Outside of that, the tutorials provide you zero information. Most of my first hour of play time was trying to figure out the absolute basics on my own, such as how to make an axe. Stones are all over the ground so that's fine, I made a stone axe head. But I can't get branches from trees or bushes, and none of the ones I loot on the ground have a stick either. So... how do I get anything crafted?

Oh, you use a stone *knife* to cut down bushes. You can't get sticks from trees, and you can't use the axe head. Instead you somehow slice apart a bush with a rock. Very intuitive. The same thing happens with the tree bark cordage -- is it made from trees? From bark? Logs? Nope, sticks. Huh? Oh, and during all of this, I have to recraft the stone knife. Because reasons. The quality on items degrades so quickly, you pointlessly have to just recraft stuff to keep up.

Well, whatever. I follow a Steam Guide to figure out what to do next. I craft a bow, now that I know how to get sticks and cordage. This requires another entire stone knife almost. And then, arrows are made individually. One at a time. Except oh -- I can't carry them because I don't have a backpack. The starting inventory space is so absurdly limited, I'm not exaggerating when I say you can literally carry one or two items until you find or craft a backpack. So, I get *one shot* against a zombie (or, sorry, "puppet") and that's it.

Which of course, since the game provides no crosshairs or literally any indication at all where the arrow will go, I uselessly launch it straight into the ground three feet away from the puppet, who then screams. I have yet to even enter a building, and a horde of about ten puppets all come down on me, spawning in within feet. Literally even the location I was just crafting in now has enemies on it. Apparently this is a new mechanic in the latest update and is intentional. Why?

Naturally, I die. I am charged "250" of some currency that was never explained. So now, I'm in "debt". To... who? To what? Why? None of this is mentioned anywhere.

I remake a character and try again. This time, "gearing up" is still tedious but now I know what to expect, and finish in about 20 minutes. I make my way towards the nearest buildings, sneaking as quietly as I can, and alas, there's apparently no puppets in this village. I wander around for a bit, make the smallest back pack possible which provides a tiny amount more space, and keep looting. Over all, I find a tomato, a kitchen knife, and a kilt. Just about three hours in, and that's it. Out of like five buildings, that's all the loot I got.

At that point I realized just how tedious the looting and gameplay loop was, and lost interest. I've submitted for a refund, hopefully Vavle will approve it on the grounds I spent the first hour looking up tutorials and scrolling through the keymap.
developer_response: Hi creepy guy in the beer aisle! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that the mechanics of the game could be better explained and that a dedicated tutorial would be more than beneficial - especially for new players. SCUM is still in Early access and we still have a lot of features, QoL improvements and content additions on the way before we fully release the game. Even though you stated that you have requested a refund, we'd like to propose that you try to modify some of the settings of your SP game by entering the main menu when in the game and then picking the ''server settings'' option where you can modify a multitude of the game's elements, such as puppet spawns, amount of loot that can be found, etc. This will enable you to tweak the game to your liking. If you don't have the willingness to do so, we'd like to invite you to at least give the game another chance once we exit Early access so you can retry the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045836160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1706107802}
review: Don't get sucked in from the video trailer for the game....you start by being thrown out of a plane, wrists bound, free falling into a zombie-infested land with no clear objectives. Very limited resources from the get-go. I know this is in early development, and I suggest that starting with some kind of weapon, or a way to create a base of operations, would be a much better start to what could be a great game someday.
developer_response: Hi jmp98531! We're sorry to see that you've found the trailers for the game to be misleading as their purpose is to acquaint the player with the general theme of the game. SCUM is designed to be a gritty and hardcore survival experience where you have to fight relentlessly for your life and resources and where you have to rely on your wits and will to survive. The aim is to gradually build up from small beginnings where you almost have nothing and then step by step creating and upgrading your gear, taking up harder challenges in order to get better gear so you can increase your chances of survival and enable yourself to build a base of your own. We acknowledge that there are things that we need to fix and improve from a technical standpoint and we'll make sure to deliver that as we'll be nearing the full release of the game, and we really hope you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198422125946', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1709401458}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969302776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1703361971}
review:
Whoever implemented the horde mechanic needs to seriously go back to the drawing board. Spawning a bunch of zombies in close proximity to the player and then them instantly know exactly where you are is beyond stupid...

Loot drop rate is to far too low, the damage ratio of what is dealt to the player versus what the player deals to the zeds is far too off balance.  The rate of infection is far to high versus the rate of the players immune system can cure. Overall experience, not fun.
developer_response: Hi DasIstBooschitt! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that there are certain issues with the puppet spawns after the new update and you'll be pleased to know that we have tweaked this system so the puppets are spawning further away from the player. We've also buffed the damage melee weapons deal to puppets, meaning that you'll have a much better chance of survival against them before you manage to secure a gun. Loot has also been increased with the new patch, but if you feel that it is still not enough, we advise that you try playing on private servers where loot is additionally increased. Regardless of the changes, we're aware that there's still a lot of balancing that needs to be done with this system and others as well. We'd also like to reiterate that there is still a lot of work ahead of us as we're nearing the full release of the game, but the we have a strong commitment to make the game as awesome as possible and to make the best hardcore survival experience, and we hope you'll give the game another shot once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984007076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6840, 'last_played': 1703361973}
review: 0.95 ruined the game for me. Before you could tweak the settings to your own preference, and make the game as challenging as you wanted. Unfortunately, the old spawning system apparently was a resource hog, and now they have this silly horde mechanic... sounds cool doesn't it.... its not, the zombies will literally spawn right in front of you even when you're standing silently still. Its so silly, and its not immersive or realistic. Bring back the old spawning mechanics, because this is awful. If you want hordes, make the zombies bunch up and wander the map like a real horde. Or make sounds cause nearby ones group up, but this random horde spawn nonsense is just tedious and really useless, it doesn't even reward players for playing stealthy. I'm out, for now, if they don't fix it, I'm out for good.
developer_response: Hi PhoenixTwo87! We're sorry to see that you were thoroughly disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that there are certain issues with the puppet spawns after the new update and you'll be pleased to know that we have tweaked this system so the puppets are spawning further away from the player. We've also buffed the damage melee weapons deal to puppets, meaning that you'll have a much better chance of survival against them before you manage to secure a gun. Regardless of the changes, we're aware that there's still a lot of balancing that needs to be done with this system and others as well. We'd also like to reiterate that there is still a lot of work ahead of us as we're nearing the full release of the game, but the we have a strong commitment to make the game as awesome as possible and to make the best hardcore survival experience, and we hope you'll give the game another shot once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113839361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4019, 'last_played': 1705223995}
review:
Just came back to play this, haven't touched it at least a year. or more.. bought it as it came out as a support to my fellow country men.
got everything updated, just get a FATAL ERROR and crash after anti cheat was initialized... cannot update or reinstall anti cheat. tried uninstalling the game, reinstalling, verifying countless times over steam.. just doesn't work..

generally interested in PVE mode. 
i played PVP, servers often crashed, not to talk about campers and shit.. just isn't fun..

fuck..
developer_response: Hi there dzombalaja! We're sorry to see that you've experienced some issues after the latest update. This sound like something that can be remedied, which is why we'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/ who will do everything they can to assist you with this. We'd hate to see you discouraged from the game because of something that can be taken care of, which is why we truly hope you'll contact us with more info so we can help you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008883508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4597, 'last_played': 1708318615}
review: Learning curve is pretty high, so unless you have tons of hours to get even remotely familiar with the game, I would pass on it.
developer_response:
Hi Caliban! 

Thank you for your feedback, we appreciate it! 
While we agree that has a steep learning curve, that's why we added the codex with the 0.95 update, which has information on every game mechanic in SCUM and should help out new players and those seeking a little reminder. 
The realism and the difficulty is actually the main draw for a lot of players, but we aim to also make the game welcoming to newcomers, hence the tutorial!
Also, during the polishing phase, every feature will be revisited and balanced out as much as possible before the 1.0 release!
Again, we appreciate your feedback and hope you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

review:

don't waste your money on this so what called game

Early Access Game are getting worse. i wont buy another early access game again XD
developer_response: Hi 魔王Maou! We're sorry to see that you were thoroughly disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that there are certain issues with the puppet spawns after the new update and you'll be pleased to know that we have tweaked this system so the puppets are spawning further away from the player. We've also buffed the damage melee weapons deal to puppets, meaning that you'll have a much better chance of survival against them before you manage to secure a gun. We understand that are melee system need more work and we'll definitely be improving that in the future. We'd also like to reiterate that there is still a lot of work ahead of us as we're nearing the full release of the game, but the we have a strong commitment to make the game as awesome as possible and to make the best hardcore survival experience, and we hope you'll give the game another shot once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020051016', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1703295812}
review:
So many cheaters in Scum.
So many bugs still after years EA.
So many game balance issues.

It feels like a walking and eating simulator. Everything else is just an add on.
developer_response: Hi Steinaar! We're sorry to see that you are disappointed with the game. We'd like to say that we completely understand your frustration and that we acknowledge that we have to do better in these regards. You'll be pleased to know that the team is committed towards ironing out all of the gripes that you have with the game and that we'll have it as polished as it can possibly be as we're nearing its full release. We're implementing means and processes to react more quickly to cheaters in order to minimize the damage they are doing on the servers. Also, we'll have a dedicated polish phase where we'll just be bugfixing and optimizing the game, making the experience as smooth as possible. Balancing is also something that will be attended to with certain aspects, and we'd like to hear more from you in this regard via https://support.scumgame.com/ if you would be so kind. All that being said, the team is committed to making the game the best possible hardcore survival experience and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

review: Boote und Items unfassbar buggy. Du stirbst, mal sind alle Items weg, mal kannst du sie wieder holen. Schon ganz geil, wenn man dann endlich mal vernünftigen Loot findet und dann alles weg ist. Boot bugt extrem auf dem Wasser rum. 10m über/unter Wasser keine Seltenheit. Und es hat jetzt schon mehrfach mich und einen Mitspieler während der Fahrt einfach runtergeworfen.  Natürlich sehr geil, wenn das >100m vor dem nächsten Ufer passiert. In dem Spiel geht es Primär um das looten, und das kann man nicht, weil man regelmäßig ohne Grund alles verliert...

review: this game does not get enough credit for its PVE its the most immersive experience iv ever had in a game at 1st it seems really confusing to keep up with all the health and treatment stats but that makes it so good . Just picture your self standing on a beautiful hill with the wind blowing through the trees looking over 1 of many many towns and locations to go loot or live at the items in game are never ending in a very good way u can strip down your cars u can shoot with a pistol from the safety of your car once u buy one u can search through anything to find something and the game runs off logic u want tools look in garages u want guns go to police stations or bunkers u want food go look in kitchens and restaurant meds u go to hospital ETC , u hate people killing u and taking your awesome loot go play PVE server thats my jam personally u have to pee and poop if u forget to pee pee or poo poo u better grab soap and clean your pants because u gonna have a stinky situation on your hands and be more prone to infections when u have a wound on your leg and finally the fact that u can put things on tables like a meal and a drink or what ever u want to put where ever u want to put it i can go on and on about how great this game is but if i do im  gonna need a book publisher XD get the game its amazing i have played many survival and zombie games nothing compared to this game u will be hooked good luck out there YOU SCUM!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974697238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 44894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5407, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1712027223}
review: My crime is arson and it took me an hour to figure out how to start a fire when I had matches and a lighter.  Imagine Rust where 99% of the containers are empty and the manual consists of watching Youtube videos.
developer_response: Hi there Mellitus1967! We're sorry to see that a lack of a proper tutorial diminished your opinion of the game. There is an in-game manual that you can access by pressing the 'TAB' button where you can find all the information on the mechanics of the game, but we acknowledge that there are better ways to more organically inform the player of the game's systems. This is something that we'll be attending to as we'll be nearing the full release of the game,which is inching ever closer as we've recently released the 0.95 patch. All that being said, we acknowledge your argument and we hope that you'll give the another chance once we fully release the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137647372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 42, 'playtime_at_review': 17297, 'last_played': 1711495908}
review:
Don't get me wrong, I love this game, I really do! Truly a fantastic idea, and the potential for this game to be a one-of-a-kind masterpiece IS THERE I SWEAR haha. I recommend it... but wow there are some serious issues that have cropped up from the most recent update. I won't repeat them here, pretty much everyone is aware of and talking about them in other reviews and community discussions.

Here's to hoping that the full release will showcase and live up to the absolute brilliance that SCUM should be... if done right. 
Honestly... and I say this with a heavy heart... hold out buying it for now... but keep this game on your radar, hope isn't gone and it could still be an absolute banger when/if the issues are addressed.

Good luck devs, I really, really hope you guys can pull this off!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012707831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 19062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18733, 'last_played': 1703302106}
review:
The game is still in it's Early Access stages of development, which means the content is somewhat limited for the moment... This is purely a Survival Game in a Zombie and Wild Animal filled environment... It uses a set map, and can cater to both PvE as well as PvP... 

Graphically, the game is alright, requiring a decent system for the highest settings... Being that it's in Early Access there are some bugs when it comes to graphics, which can be frustrating for some folks... The biggest bug being that some folks, when driving too fast in a vehicle, can suddenly drive their vehicles under the map because the visuals did not catch up fast enough, which usually (not always) ejects you from the vehicle... The vehicle can either become unrecoverable, including anything stored in it, or the vehicle might even get launched somewhere (that typically involves the vehicles destruction but not always)... So go into this game knowing that... It doesn't make the game unplayable, but it does push some folks to keeping their vehicles under a certain speed limit, depending on their system, connection speed, etc...

Game play wise, this game uses a more involved system for many things, with only a slight amount of automation... I actually like deeper systems, so it doesn't bother me much... As an example, the crafting system requires manually doing certain tasks and/or steps in constructing certain things... Like crafting the various components and then constructing the whole item... Or planning out building structures, then hand delivering the various required components for construction/upgrading...

Some other things to keep in mind are food and drink, which breaks down into various metabolism based things such as vitamin levels, protein, fats, and do on... You even have to pay attention to going to the bathroom when needed, so that you are not suddenly forced to go in the middle of a fight... :)

The game can be played solo or in teams, and/or a mix...

The only big downside I've seen thus far is how the developer keeps putting out DLC's for a game that is still in Early Access development... It's mostly cosmetic stuff or items that look different but are no better then what can already be acquired in game already... So it's not pay-to-win stuff, but it is sorta annoying that they are pushing DLC's when the game isn't even finished yet... Feels more like a huge money grab, which I can only hope is being used for further development, and not lining the owners pockets...

All in all, the game is still in it's early days, so I expect to update my review when the game eventually goes full release... It's not a bad game, but can eventually feel a bit empty of non-repeatable content, if you don't have folks to play with in order to keep it feeling somewhat fresh... Would I pay full price? I did, but it's really up to you as long as you realize the game is still mid-development... I wouldn't really buy the DLC's unless you enjoy the game enough, and want to help the developers further finance development...

author: {'steamid': '76561199585269070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1703561775}
review: Amazing game. Think of DayZ but 2x better in almost ever aspect (seriously, it is literally just a better DayZ) Solo is very fun since you can customize everything from Item Drop rate to Zombie Damage, to even Mech damage (or you can disable them entirely) Multiplayer is very enjoyable aswell, there is a server for everyone. Want a PVP driven server? There are multiple. Want a server for casual players? There are multiple. Want a server with strictly PVE? There are multiple. Whatver you're looking for, you will find something that works for you. The community is great aswell, there are alot of people willing to teach you the ropes of the game. While it can be a little overwhelming at first, it doesn't take too long to get a grasp/understanding of most game mechanics.

developer_response: Hi KingOfTheDead! We're sorry to see that a lack of option for multiplayer has diminished your opinion of the game. SCUM is still in Early access and currently we're committed to bringing al the promised content additions and feature improvements leading up to the full 1.0 release of the game. Once we get there, we'll be able to talk more about additional ways for our players to engage with the game, which are, in this context, additional modes to connect and play the game in multiplayer. When we get there, we hope you'll give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101621097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2500, 'last_played': 1702634170}
review:
I haven't seen and experienced anything like this before... a bunch of ridiculous Amateurs on every level.

So, if you like the experience of games that become more Alpha state the higher the version number goes, where NPC's spawn out of thin air and your collected stuff despawns into thin air: here you can throw your money out of the window for exactly that.
Do the devs care and try hard to fix their F-UP? Apologize? Do you expect transparency in the dev-process? A roadmap? You don't get that here. It's a mess.

But don't forget to buy some nice dance moves DLC too! Maybe at least that's something that works in this game... (Spoiler: I read in the forums it doesn't) :D

SCUM, literally!

author: {'steamid': '76561198864791418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1609, 'last_played': 1702688890}
review: It was a great game before the update, now its impossible to play alone and hard to play with my girl and teammates, its a shame because im my opinion it was the best survival game. I was even convincing a lot of friends from my server on DayZ Brasil to come play with us, now ill have to refund some of them myself for a bad reccomendation haha
developer_response: Hi Berseven! We're sorry to see that the last update made the game too challenging for your teammates. The horde update was launched with certain issues, such as puppets spawning too close to the players. You'll be pleased to know that we have tweaked this system so that puppets spawn further away from the players and that we have buffed the melee weapon damage that you deal to puppets to give the players a greater fighting chance in the early game. We'll also be looking further into the situation and will provide additional tweaks if they will be necessary and we'll make sure to improve and polish the overall experience of the game before the 1.0 version of it and we hope that you'll be there with your team when we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051899716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 26980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26980, 'last_played': 1657435139}
review:
After 5 years of waiting for the server files the dev's said would be released at build 1.0.
Now the dev's are getting close to 1.0 they now state they will consider releasing them after 1.0.
So much for any trust with these dev's even after all the BS skin DLC they kept pumping out and not fixing things from years ago.
developer_response: Hi kir-kanos! We're sorry to see that the unavailability of server files has diminished your opinion of the game. While 0.95 is very close to 1.0, the idea was never to release the server files prior to the release or even with the full release of the game. It was never explicitly confirmed that they will be released in those time frames. If you understood it in that way, we apologize for the miscommunication. To be completely frank, the lead up to the 1.0 will be hectic and our main focus will be delivering the promised content additions and to make sure that the game is polished and optimized and that it is running as smoothly as possible. Once the game will be out, we'll also be all-hands-on-deck for any crazy scenarios or issues that might pop up and until we're certain that everything's stable, we'll be able to focus on additional options and features for our players. We understand that this might not be the answer that you are looking for, but this is realistic and truthful and we'd like to kindly ask you for a bit more patience and understanding until we get there.

die Server sind unter aller Sau, leider habe ich meinen Kompletten Spiel Progress verloren, weil sich der Server einfach abgeschalten hatte, während wir in einem Flugzeug waren.

das ist leider auch einer der Gründe, warum ich das Game nichtmehr spielen werde.

author: {'steamid': '76561199262408191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 102985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71871, 'last_played': 1709949215}
review:
This game is great! Although there are many servers you can play on, you will have to find the one that fits you. There is so much to do in this game and boy does time fly by when playing! You get to choose the scum life YOU want to live. You can try to survive without a weapon and let me tell you it won't be easy after this Horde Update. Keep in mind there are other players in the game and it is best to assume they are not friendly especially if you are running around in a PvP ZONE. If you are new to the game I highly recommend joining one of the Facebook groups for any questions about the game because there are a lot of helpful people on there. Well, I hope you enjoy the game as much as I do.
-SCUM <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198887247292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 299945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3968, 'playtime_at_review': 270998, 'last_played': 1712499690}
review:
Seit Hordenupdate im Singleplayer nicht mehr spielbar. Ein ehemals tolles Spiel ist mittlerweile total kaputt gemacht worden und den Spielzustand und die Handlungsweisen der Entwickler kann man nur noch desolat nennen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198236644686', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 30816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18917, 'last_played': 1710279299}
review:
Liebe Gaming-Community,

ich möchte meine Begeisterung für das Spiel SCUM teilen und betonen, warum es meiner Meinung nach DayZ in vielen Aspekten übertrifft. SCUM ist zweifellos ein Meisterwerk der Survival-Gaming-Welt, das durch eine beeindruckende Vielfalt an Funktionen und Innovationen glänzt.

Die Grafik von SCUM ist atemberaubend und schafft eine immersive Welt, die bis ins kleinste Detail liebevoll gestaltet ist. Die realistische Darstellung der Umgebung, gepaart mit dynamischem Wetter und Tag-Nacht-Zyklen, sorgt für eine fesselnde Spielerfahrung, die weit über das hinausgeht, was wir von vergleichbaren Spielen gewohnt sind.

Die Charakterentwicklung in SCUM ist ein weiterer Punkt, der das Spiel hervorstechen lässt. Die umfassenden Anpassungsmöglichkeiten und die tiefe Progression verleihen dem Spieler eine persönliche Note, die in DayZ oft vermisst wird. Das Skill-System ist gut durchdacht und trägt dazu bei, dass jede Entscheidung des Spielers taktische Konsequenzen hat.

Ein besonders lobenswerter Aspekt von SCUM ist die realistische Simulation von Hunger, Durst und Gesundheit. Dies trägt nicht nur zur Immersion bei, sondern erfordert auch kluges Ressourcenmanagement und schafft so eine zusätzliche taktische Tiefe im Spiel. Die Vielfalt der verfügbaren Waffen und Ausrüstungen sowie die realistische Schadensmechanik machen die Kämpfe in SCUM zu intensiven und aufregenden Herausforderungen.

Zusammenfassend kann ich mit Überzeugung sagen, dass SCUM DayZ in vielen Bereichen übertrifft. Es ist nicht nur ein visuelles Fest für die Sinne, sondern auch ein taktisch anspruchsvolles und innovatives Survival-Spiel. SCUM setzt neue Maßstäbe für das Genre und sollte von jedem Survival-Fan unbedingt erlebt werden.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen,
Paradeo

author: {'steamid': '76561198097700077', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 14356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13081, 'last_played': 1710055676}
review:
It is often compared to DayZ. Although it is an open world survival game with zombies geared more towards realism, It is not well suited for people new to survival genre. This is meant for those of us who have many hours in survival games and want one that is immersive and deep. Even with 200+ hours I am still learning the game and have yet to build a base. I have had a car a handful of times. Its brutal but beautiful. Still rough around the edges, and needs some work. But the work I have seen done to the game through early access keeps me coming back.

TLDR: If you're a survival veteran, you would like it. If you're new, do some looking into it before purchasing. Go watch some videos as it's a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171947726', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 273876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 12829, 'playtime_at_review': 200124, 'last_played': 1712494588}
review:
I play SCUM from the very first day it was up and my review will be the following: 

SCUM is an early access survival game, and the experience has been nothing short of thrilling. Here's why I'm excited about the game's potential:

1. Engaging Gameplay:
The core gameplay mechanics are solid, offering a unique blend of [mention key features, e.g., crafting, exploration, and combat]. The challenges presented are both rewarding and immersive, keeping me on the edge of my seat.

2. Dynamic World:
The game world is not only vast but also dynamic, evolving as new updates are rolled out. I'm constantly discovering new places, encountering diverse creatures, and adapting to ever-changing environmental conditions.

3. Developer Interaction:
It's clear that the development team is passionate about their project. Regular updates and transparent communication on the roadmap reassure players that the game is in good hands. The responsiveness to community feedback is commendable and reflects a commitment to delivering a polished final product.

4. Graphics and Atmosphere:
The visuals are stunning, creating a captivating atmosphere that enhances the overall gaming experience. Whether it's the play of light at sunrise or the ominous shadows in the deep forests, the attention to detail adds a level of immersion that few games achieve.

5. Potential for Growth:
Early access is all about potential, and SCUM has a ton of it. The foundation is strong, and I can't wait to see how the game evolves with future updates. The roadmap promises exciting features, and I'm eager to be part of this journey from the beginning.

In conclusion, SCUM has exceeded my expectations for an early access title. It's a testament to the dedication of the developers and the incredible potential this game holds. If you're a fan of survival games, diving into SCUM is an absolute must!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037288805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 41503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2467, 'playtime_at_review': 31255, 'last_played': 1712499173}
review:
Bekam es geschenkt und hat anfangs echt Spaß gemacht, aber mittlerweile ist das immer mehr Frust. 
Das untote Viehzeug gibts in verschiedenen Varianten, aber alle wohl damals in der Schule Erster im Dauerlauf und teilweise auch Sprinten, sowie durchweg Jahrgangsbeste in Hochsprung. Im Fitnessstudioabo hatten sowieso alle. Aber Pfadfinder waren die keine und keineswegs still. Immerhin eine eklatante Schwäche...
Aber Seit Herbst hört man die Zombies/Püppchen nicht mehr, es sei denn sie sind im Umkreis von 3-4m - aber dann schlagen sie einen schon tot. War schon nicht schön, aber ging noch...
Jetzt kam das Horde-System, welches man echt als Gefahr sehen muss und darf man auch mal die Hufe schwingen...oder muss. Zusätzlich fallen sie jetz gerne alle paar Minuten im Dreipack(minimum) um dich herum vom Himmel, abgeworfen durch StuKas, so nahe wie die runterkommen!?! Das war schon zum kübeln, man kommt nicht mal zum looten...
Und Gestern gabs nen Patch der deren Schaden nochmal erhöhte!!! 2-3 Schläge und du beginnst schon zu verbluten...selbstverständlich auch gleich wenn man frisch anfängt! Ist ja leider nicht so das man hier überall vernünftige Ausstattung findet, nein mal läuft erst herum wie in der Steinzeit...und kommt kaum aus ihr heraus.
Meine Frage an die Entwickler - spielt ihr euer Spiel auch mal ohne "Dev-Cheats" oder wollte ihr die Leute von Server prügeln???? Diese Richtung ist meines Erachtens die Falsche.
Neulinge werden da ganz schnell euer Spiel zurückgeben, - hoffentlich - jedenfalls solange es einseitig in diese Richtung geht. 

Solange kann ich Käufern nur davon abraten, es sei denn ihr steht auf SM.

Grüße Heinz B.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312101412', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 14374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10492, 'last_played': 1710668498}
review: A fun game ruined by constant issues and bad game design/developers, with the most recent update, zombies/puppets will constantly spawn behind you and the horde system just teleports zombies 15m away from you. The game fails to load buildings and terrain constantly while running on an m.2 drive, causing your vehicles to fall through the world and vanish, deleting your hard work and everything in it because for some reason the developers didn't make a failsafe for vehicles doing that. If a building or object renders in on top of you, you become stuck, needing an admin or to suicide to get out. The game has been out for 5+ years, this stuff ruins the game and has needed fixing for years.
developer_response: Hi DawnSapphire! We're sorry to see that you've had a bad experience with the newly updated game. We acknowledge that there were issues with the spawning puppets and you'll be pleased to know that this was tweaked in one of the hotfixes that we've put out after the patch. The situation that happened to you should not occur again and we hope that you'll continue playing the game and give it another go.

review:

Dont waste your money.  Can't believe they have the balls to charge for this shit
developer_response: Hi there IED Ernie! We're sorry to see that you did not find enjoyment with the game. SCUM is still in Early access and we acknowledge that the game has certain issues and that we still have a lot of work to do. That is why we'd like to emphasize that the team is wholeheartedly committed to completing the game, improving the existing systems and features, and bring more additional content to the base game which will further enrich the experience of the game. Given your harsh words, we understand that it is unlikely that you will give the game another chance, but we'd like to extend an invitation and ask that you give it another chance as we'll be exiting Early access in the foreseeable future so you can see how the game has changed and improved.

review:
システム面やゲームシステム、操作性等特に不満を感じるところはありません。

ただ、仕方ないとはいえローカルデータを含めてワールドスワイプが少なからずあることや、数百KBや数十ＭＢの少量のアップデートパッチでも、その度にディスクへの書き込みが４０Ｇ程度発生することでSSDに負担をかけるか、HDDでは書き込み時間が膨大、かつ失敗があるのが不満です。ゲームシステムの構造を見直してほしいです。

review:
Scum is considered one of most complex and difficult Survival games. The game can be challenging, especially for those who are new to the genre. However, once you get the hang of the game, it can be very rewarding.

It’s important to remember that the game is still in development and has some bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353276411', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1703127933}
review: The fighting mechanics are kinda garbage. Way to many zombies that are all way to overpowered. Expect to die a lot. I regret this purchase. I do enjoy the quality in the health system as far as depth but its a waste since all i do is get pushed in a corner by 15 zombies and i have no way to get away from them. Some cool stuff but not enough to warrant a purchase. wait till they learn how to balance the zombies and fighting mechanics.
developer_response: Hi alex westland! We're sorry to see that you did not find enjoyment in the game. We acknowledge that the hordes may have not worked as intended when the patch came out. You'll be pleased to know that we have tweaked this system so that the hordes don't spawn directly on you. We've also balanced the odds by significantly increasing the damage you do to puppets with melee weapons. All that being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance and hope that you'll have a much better experience with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401135430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 36570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29801, 'last_played': 1705725906}
review: This game has now been in early access for 72 years, game is constantly broken and a nightmare for admins to keep stable servers going. I have experienced server crashes and corruption over multiple hosts and you lose all your hard work with roll backs. Do your research before handing over your cash for this game.
developer_response: Hi there Pandemic! We're sorry that you are experiencing server issues with the game and that they are giving you a hard time. The game has been in Early access for quite some time, that is true. But we are doing the best we can with our capabilities we have at hand. As for the server issues, we'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/ who will do everything they can to assist you with the issues you are experiencing. We'd like nothing more than these issues fixed so we really hope that you will contact us and help us get rid of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098188257', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1703116626}
review:
Yeah, I'm about 90 minutes in, and frankly, I just don't like it.  The inventory system is a massive pain in the ass, and combat is errratic and wonky.  I don't understand why so many people like this game.  Crafting ANYTHING relevant is a massive pain in the ass.

I'm not going to refund it though, I've wasted 20 bucks on many things.  It's not broken, it's just the unconventional inventory system is completely unfun to play with.  It's not like Ark, or The Front at all.
developer_response: Hi there islander! Since you have only 1.5 hours in the game, we'll assume that you did not manage to find some better clothes or gear that would extend your inventory space. Clothes (especially the starting inmate uniform) does not give a lot of inventory space, meaning that you need something to help you until you find something better. We suggest trying to craft an improvised courier backpack. It's easy to craft and will provide you with the necessary inventory space until you find something better. Hope this will help a bit and we hope that this will not discourage you from further enjoying the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076444947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4843, 'last_played': 1703085464}
review: a new patch is out, I begin to download it, it finishes updating. In an hour I notice another 60 Mb of another update, begin updating the game and it begins to patch the whole game which is about 60 Gb. After it finishes patching another 60 Gb update begins to download. And it goes into a loop of endless downloading/patching. I begin to think that developers nowadays become more and more incompetent because they keep releasing raw alpha versions for real money and they dont have any incentive to work hard because people would buy any crap in a nice wrap. It is time to forbid developers from publishing their alpha crap for real money.
developer_response: Hi there Reac! We're sorry to see that you're experiencing issues with the download loop. We'd like to kindly direct you towards our support team at https://support.scumgame.com/ who will do everything they can to assist you with the issue you are experiencing. We'd hate to see you discouraged from the game because of something that can be fixed and attended to, which is why we hope you will contact us.

author: {'steamid': '76561198965785370', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 386764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364625, 'last_played': 1707936160}

author: {'steamid': '76561199389609636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16271, 'last_played': 1703390264}
review:
O primeiro jogo de sobrevivência que jogo, e já ouvi dizer que é o mais difícil de todos. Comprei para jogar pois vi que não tem somente zumbis, como os Mechs (Sentinelas) e agora mutantes em alguns bunkers. Os gráficos, a imersão, são sensacionais.
Entretanto, os bugs como as "pontes fantasmas" (ao atravessa-las de caminhonetes, você cai no rio e perde seu veículo com tudo dentro e com risco de morte), as quedas repentinas dos servidores oficiais (se você tiver dentro do barco, você automaticamente cai dele quando retornar), e agora na última atualização o respawn de zumbis extremamente rápido (menos de 4 min), são muito, muito irritantes!
Eles precisam consertar isso, mas com urgência! Se arrumarem já melhora 50% o jogo.

No mais, eu recomendo para geral, é um excelente jogo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011575995', 'num_games_owned': 1042, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 3571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3571, 'last_played': 1652501712}
review:
Used to be a good gun game, with a decent survival game attached.

Now it's a good gun game that's punished with a shit survival game.
developer_response: Hi Arkitekt! We're sorry to see that the newest update is not to your liking. We acknowledge that there were some issues with the hordes (such as spawning too near to the player). You'll be pleased to know that we've attended to this issue by tweaking the distance of their spawn points in the first hotfix after the patch and have also balanced things out by buffing the damage you deal to puppets with melee weapons. Keep in mind that you can also enjoy the game on private servers where puppets are minimized or non-existent, so you can try those if you are inclined. All this being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200068973', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4371, 'last_played': 1703077344}
review:
After 5 years this game still has the worst melee combat I've ever seen in my life.. I craft a spear and I have to spam click like a maniac just to pinch the zombie into the stomach like that's gotta do smth... Just let me stab him in the f head dude wth
Also the same for running animation, jumping, climbing over fences etc. Really disappointed in the game!
developer_response: Hi DeSiNNeR! We're sorry to see that the animations soured your experience of the game. We're aware that melee combat is a bit dated and that it needs to be spruced up and you'll be pleased to know that this is something that we'll aim to improve down the line, as we'll as other animations. The game is still in Early access and we still have a lot of work ahead of us, and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we fully release it with all the necessary fixes and improvements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184496693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 28530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 745, 'playtime_at_review': 16048, 'last_played': 1711994797}
review: Full of cheaters at the moment (70% of population are Chinese). No point in playing this game right now since they can always teleport inside of your base and steal all of your stuff without even unlocking or destroying anything. Waste of time looting something (which takes hours and days) when you can lose it in an unfair way. No matter how many times you report and they get banned they will always come back. Some other solution must be found! Game as survival game is very good but unplayable right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198974609147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 58206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 398, 'playtime_at_review': 52247, 'last_played': 1711885981}

author: {'steamid': '76561198141459820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 14039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 752, 'playtime_at_review': 3718, 'last_played': 1711835333}
review: Thanks for making the zombie respawn one meter in front of me. The wonderful update 0.95 means that I will never run out of bots to kill again... The game is unplayable at the moment, respawning bots is a joke at this point
developer_response: Hi there HawkenRoc! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. The situation with horde spawning that you mentioned did not work as intended. We've heard the complaints from our community and you'll be pleased to know that we have attended to this issue and tweaked the horde spawns so that they don't spawn directly on you. We're also looking into ways to further tweak this system if it will be necessary. That being said, we hope you'll give the game another chance and hope that you'll now have a better experience with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094798463', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 26426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 189, 'playtime_at_review': 5440, 'last_played': 1711376754}
review:
我愿意称呼0.95的更新是最差一次更新
僵尸凭空刷新，家里也会刷，尸潮无限刷新，僵尸不靠近不刷新（然后自爆刷脸）
地图加载漫慢，车直接卡桥里面，车直接飞下断桥，车直接进栅栏出不来，车上三楼，车子莫名其妙没电
这版本吞的东西也多了起来，弹夹都无所谓了，背包箱子等大物件都吞
还有游戏新陈代谢的体质简直是离谱，必须按跑的距离来增加，为什么不按耐力增加
这还只是更新后完了2天得出来的
I would like to call the 0.95 update a very terrible update
Zombies are refreshed out of thin air, and they are also refreshed at home. Zombies are refreshed indefinitely. Zombies are not refreshed unless they are close (and then self-destruct to refresh their faces).
The map loads slowly, the car gets stuck in the bridge, the car flies directly off the broken bridge, the car goes directly into the fence and cannot get out, the car is on the third floor, and the car is inexplicably out of battery.
This version also swallows more things. It doesn’t even matter the magazine. It also swallows backpacks, boxes and other large objects.
Also, the metabolism in the game is simply ridiculous. It must be increased based on the distance you run. Why not increase it based on your endurance?
This is just what I got after playing for 2 days.
developer_response: Hi there HMSVanguard! We're sorry to see that the new update left you disappointed. You'll be pleased to know that the team has already tweaked the spawning of the hordes, meaning that it should not be an issue anymore. As for the vehicles, we're working to fix as many issues as we can, as soon as we can. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we manage to roll out these fixes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030995631', 'num_games_owned': 20, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 20411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6, 'playtime_at_review': 16990, 'last_played': 1712449573}
review: После более 300 часов игры могу сказать, что её первичная атмосфера значительно испортилась после обновления 0,95. Идея орды изначально выглядит интересно, но на практике крайне плохо реализована и больше раздражает. Теперь зомби спавнятся буквально из воздуха, на небольшом удалении от игрока. Даже если игрок действовал на локации по стелсу, то появившиеся зомби всё равно будут ориентированы на местоположение игрока и в ускоренном порядке направятся к нему (прям как на гироскутерах). Также в одиночном и PVE режимах теперь невозможно использовать снайперские винтовки, т.к. все локации изначально пустые. Раньше окружающий мир отличался динамичность и был живым. Гуляющие по локации зомби могли конфликтовать с дикими животными. А спящие в помещениях зомби заставляли просчитывать игрока свои действия и вести себя тихо. Может быть разработчики хотели сделать лучше, но по факту, если читать форумы, только ухудшили общее впечатление игроков. По моему мнению необходимо оставить старые алгоритмы спавна зомби на локациях, вернуть спящих зомби и чтобы орда формировалась из уже имеющихся на локации мертвяков, а не возникала из пустоты. И область её формирования была бы большой (в радиусе 100-200 метров). В данном случае или ты действуешь по стелсу, лутая определённую локацию, избегая траты патронов на её зачистку или сначала её зачищаешь, а потом уже лутаешь. Короче, был бы выбор стратегии и бОльшая вариативность игры. Несмотря на это, могу сказать, что разработчики достаточно активно поддерживают игру, добавляют новый контент и заливают хотфиксы. Могу ли я сейчас рекомендовать игру? Скорее нет, чем да, т.к. общее впечатление о ней значительно испортилось после последнего обновления.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073132912', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7884, 'last_played': 1703442336}

author: {'steamid': '76561198859206419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1703787825}
review:
Game is really tough for the new player, to be honest it wasn't so fun for me in the beginning when I was learning the ropes; I kept failing and ending in fiascos having to start all over again after spending hours and hours on what sometimes felt like going backwards up a steep hill.

There's a LOT to learn and in the beginning you are going to be confused, hurt and most likely fail again and again and you may be left scratching your head asking questions like "how on earth can I do that?!" "how am I supposed to avoid that?!?!?!" "omg I died AGAIN!". 

You can try a community server with massively increased loot and/or with welcome packs or even daily helping packs being able to be claimed; that experience can be more lenient to new players and more or less can hold your hand a little.

But once you get a good grip on how to survive in the game you can certainly enjoy the challenge of surviving and progressing on official servers. 

In fact once you hit 140'ish hours or so you may be starting to feel that it maybe is a little to easy to acquire resources like food, water, weapons etc. Because once you know where they are and have got great experience in effectively and safely combating the "puppets" (zombie type enemies) as well as know how to deal with wounds, you'll be running a surplus of stuff and wont have too much trouble surviving the island. But then there's pvp and the ever continual challenge of amazing more wealth in the form of the games permanent money resource "gold" that will NOT be wiped on server wipes. Every time there's an update servers will wipe off all items and bases. Only thing that will be kept is your character (but not it's gear or inventory) and all your progress for it, be that skill points, attribute points and all of the metabolism stats like amount of muscle and fat on your body. This makes character progression a fun and very long term goal that will persist beyond each update as the game develops. I really like this as it keeps me interested and invested to come back to play.

-------

To help you a little with a very crucial consideration on how to create your character I will suggest you think about what skills to choose for your character. Here is a couple of suggestions:


[h1]BUILD #1 THE REGULAR[/h1] 
3 points in all Attributes: STRENGTH 3, DEXTERITY 3, CONSTITUTION 3, INTELLIGENCE 3. This will allow you to achieve Advanced tier skill level for all skills. 
For Skills I would then suggest: 
[b]Archery to Advanced[/b] (so that you can be very effective with the basic crafted bow and simple wooden arrows which are very easy to make in the beginning, 
[b]Thievery to Advanced[/b] (so that you can lockpick locks much more easily. You can go into police stations in many cities and lockpick their gun lockers and in that way acquire many guns and ammo and all kinds of accessories for them).
[b]Running Medium[/b] (good compromise between extra running speed and still allowing points to assign to Endurance)
[b]Endurance Medium[/b] (Consume less food/water/energy and also have higher max stamina pool and better stamina recovery).
[b]Medical Advanced[/b] (Helps recover from wounds faster, and faster and more effective bandaging of wounds; which can mean the difference between bleeding to death or managing to stop the bleeding when you have only 10% hitpoints left, but at least you live and can recover...!)


[h1]BUILD #2 THE SLICK THIEF[/h1] 
Here's a different idea for an alternative skinny, speedy gonzales, agile character build:
STRENGTH 1, CONSTITUTION 4, DEXTERITY 5, INTELLIGENCE 2. 
[b]Archery midway through Basic[/b]
[b]Thievery to Advanced[/b]
[b]Stealth midway through Medium[/b]
[b]Running skill to Advanced[/b]
[b]Endurance skill halfway through to Basic[/b]
[b]Medical skill halfway through Medium[/b]

(REVIEW BECAME TOO LONG HERE, SEE EXPLANATION FOR BUILD #2 IN THE COMMENTS).

review: Games great dont get me wrong but i would avoid it atm until they fixed what they did in the recent horde update, puppets only spawn  when ur close / in town and respawn every 3-5 minutes. so dont tab out!  and any every puppet that notices you will call in a horde and that process will repeat everytime u come across one. even right after fighting a horde  off. puppet spawns need to be changed back to how it originally was and a new puppet type needs to be added that is the only one that can call for hordes. ( example, the 7d2d screamer )
developer_response: Hi there Soggy! We're sorry to see that you've had a bad run with hordes in the new update, but you'll be pleased to know that we have attended to the exact issue you've mentioned and tweaked the spawn points of the puppets so that they don't spawn near to the player. You'll also be pleased to know that we've provided further balancing of the game by considerably buffing the damage dealt to the puppets with melee weapons, meaning that you will have a much better odds of survival until you get a firearm. That being said, we hope that you'll give the game another chance and see if the situation's improved.

However, after that, we'll be more able to talk about additional features such as the ones you've mentioned and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296314148', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11127, 'last_played': 1708294892}
review: I am always excited for every update, maybe this is the one that brings me back and makes me enjoy what was a very beautiful game with in depth mechanics. But with every update this games moves further from the survival part and more to a FPS with survival mechanics just that your character is amazingly fragile. I do love a hardcore survival experience but for me the immersion ends at invincible enemies and invisible hordes which spawn from nowhere. Why give me weapons if MECHs are invincible? Why give me all this survival features if they don't affect my experience or if they do they do it by a a very slight almost non important bit. I believe that instead adding new enemies with every update you could've added a diseases update by now. Also, even if you are a skilled player and you can stealth your way into a bunker with a fresh spawned character and find rare items you sell them for currency which you can't even use, why not? Because of that FP barrier which to me makes no sense whatsoever.
developer_response: Hi there Alecs! We're sorry to see that you feel that the game is steering away from its survival roots. Survival will always be a core pillar of SCUM and all the new features that finding their way into the game serve as elements that bring variation into the overall gameplay experience. As for the hordes, you'll be pleased to know that we've tweaked that system so that puppets don't spawn next to the player. The team is committed towards providing as many improvements and changes to the existing systems and to add as many new and previously featured content as we're nearing the full release of the game and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135065009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5332, 'last_played': 1703028015}

Und dann noch "Die Horde" In jedem Zombiegame ist es mittlerweile so das sie dich in Massen verfolgen. Ich war froh das es hier nicht so stressig ist. Aber jetzt... Grauenvoll. Viel zu stressig/schwierig geworden das Spiel für mich zumindest. Es macht einfach keinen Spaß mehr.
Echt schade. Ich habe das Spiel echt gerne gespielt. Jetzt habe ich es wieder deinstalliert und werde es nie wieder anfassen. Das macht mich echt traurig.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986932070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1252, 'last_played': 1703006218}
review:
[h1] So realistic, playing it is punishment. [/h1]
Perfect for masochists, the gaming version of self-harming. After 3 wipes of Tarkov, I thought i had experience of steep learning curve and challenging gameplay. You spawn in with nothing, every time you die, possibly miles from where you need to be. 20 minutes of running at the beginning of every life, coupled with PUBG grade melee combat makes for an extremely unrewarding time. Wait, the best bit is you only get 10 deaths, then everything you've built up, inch by inch, is gone and you get to start all over! 
I gave it a good solid try because my friends are playing it, but i'd rather insert wooden spikes under my fingernails than suffer through this any more. So glad i got it on sale...
developer_response: Hi The LovelyLimey! We're sorry to see that you were thoroughly disappointed with the game. While the game was always envisioned as a gritty, hardcore survival game, we acknowledge that some things can be tweaked to further enhance the overall experience of the game. The game is still in Early access and there's still a lot that can and will be improved as we'll be nearing the full release of the game. That being said, we really hope that you'll give the game another chance once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561199036594890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1428, 'last_played': 1708438059}
review:
23h de jeux et j'ai encore tout a apprendre ! 
je sais tout juste craft un couteau, me débrouiller a manger et a craft un sac a dos, mais petit a petit je prends plaisir notamment a créer un coffre et l'enterrer quelque part en attendant de m'attaquer aux bases et véhicules quand j'aurais plus d’expérience.
Pour les débutants comme moi il ne faut pas désespérer, le début est difficile ( 1er saut j'ai ouvert mon parachute trop tard, 2eme saut j'ai traversé a la nage je me suis fais manger par un requin etc ) mais après c'est un plaisir, on découvre tout ce que le jeu propose est c'est presque démotivant tellement on sait pas par ou commencer mais il faut tenir bon, c'est en mourant qu'on apprend, et allez sur le discord fr et regardez les tutos youtube, les devs sont a fond sur le jeu et la version 1.0 est actuellement pas encore sorti.
j'ai récupérer mon 1er glock avec chargeur aujourd'hui et je l'ai joué vendredi 13 après avoir trouvé une tronçonneuse. j'ai de quoi manger et boire et j'ai un sac randonnée, comme quoi même nul comme moi on progresse petit a petit ! excellent jeu que je préfère a Dayz mais ca c'est perso et je trouve que le jeu est méconnu et il faudrait faire de la pub car il est beau agréable et avec beaucoup de potentiel !

author: {'steamid': '76561198853996625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 77824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 81, 'playtime_at_review': 75422, 'last_played': 1712249591}
review:
I recently changed a negative review to a positive one after some of the horde spawning issues were made more tolerable and the performance issues seemed to have been resolved.

However, after now being able to play the game again I do not recommend it in it's current state.

As is, not recommended. I thought the hunting had been reverted to the old system. It hasn't. It's terrible. You hear an animal, you focus in on the direction and follow it (clues and sound) halfway down a mountain, going South. The next audio cue/clue happens and it's now 180 degrees in the opposite direction, North, back up the mountain. Almost back at the top another audio cue/clue, 180 degrees again, South, back down the mountain FFS! PLEASE, listen to the community and bring back the animals, all of them.

The horde system is way better then at 0.95 release, they at least spawn behind objects now and out of sight, which is still not ideal, we want to clear an area, again, please listen to the community. Many people have also requested a massive roaming horde, this would be awesome, maybe 2 or 3 big roaming hordes at any one time across the map would be amazing.

Some loot-able objects appear to be bugged and will trigger a horde when searched. You can sneak around an entire POI undetected until you search that one box that will trigger a horde and then they coming running to your exact location from very very far away.

This horde system and hunting system cannot be tweaked, they need to go, tweaking will not change what it is, it will only change how it behaves and we don't like what it is or how it behaves.

On a positive note, the way the crafting menu is now organised is great, so much cleaner and easier to navigate and craft stuff. I'm crafting things I would never have given a second thought about. The tips / guides as a new spawn are also very helpful, I learnt about things I never knew about previously.

I am still having fun when I play but the devs are pulling an "Apple" on us, taking things away and making the experience terrible, they then re-introduce the things they took away later but with serious limitations and constraints and we are "happier" because it is way batter than the current state of things - but - it is not what it was originally.
developer_response: Hi there SlutNuts! It was with a heavy heart that we have read your review and we have to say that we are extremely sorry to hear this from a long time fan such as yourself. Some of the points you've brought up are valid and we completely understand your position. Some of the decisions that were made for the game were brought forth as means to preserve the stability and functioning of it. The development has gone for a long time and the ideas that were introduced were always part of that initial vision, but were realized at a later date as time went on and as time for the implementation for some of these ideas came. What we want to emphasize right now is that the team is wholeheartedly committed to delivering the full 1.0 release of the game along with the promised features, and to polish it to the point where virtually all the underlying issues that are present within the game will be gone. With this specific situation with the hordes, we've upheld our reputation for reacting quickly with certain issues by tweaking the horde spawn points so that they spawn further away from the player and have also evened the odds and balanced the combat with the puppets by buffing the damage you do with melee weapons to them. All of this being said, we'd like to thank you for the time you've invested in the game and would love nothing more than to see you return and give the game a chance one more time when we fully release it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024888640', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 15525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12631, 'last_played': 1707127437}
review:
Absolutely terrible. DO NOT TOUCH.

Latest update has broken the game and they will be going forward with this tripe. 18 years and it's still a schoolboy project. Unless you are on a server with settings that you might as well be playing without puppets, or are the first in there, you will NOT get a vehicle, you will NOT live and you will NOT enjoy yourself. Done with this. WAs O K at best 6 months ago, then they took 12x too long to modulize vehicles and now they ruined the game. Puppets run 3x faster than you, so if you attract more than one, its game over. Bushes no longer do anything, they wallhack right through and fixate on your hitbox. Dev does not care, they got their undeserved cash.
developer_response: Hello Iced! We're sorry to see that the game disappointed you over the past few months. The game is designed to not shower you with loot, which means that putting together a vehicle is an achievement in itself that is meant to feel rewarding. You will definitely have a harder time putting one together if you are solo, but with a bit of luck and by looking for parts in the right places, it is not impossible to make it yourself. The puppets are quick, but are not impossible to outmaneuver. The leaner ones are fast, but can be quickly dispatched even with early game crafted melee weapons, and the bulkier ones can be outrun. However, we acknowledge that we still have a lot of work to do with optimizing and improving the overall experience of the game, as well as adding numerous content additions that will further elevate the game. While it is unlikely that you'll return based on your harsh words, we'd still like to express our hope that you will give the game another chance once we'll roll out the aforementioned updates.
